content_chunk: "# ABOUT\nSCALING THE ZENITH OF EXCELLENCE\nDriven by its commitment to provide quality technical education
column3: Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College has become the best Engineering institution in Uttar Pradesh.\nAjay Kumar Garg Engineering College (AKGEC)
column4: Ghaziabad is affiliated to Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam Technical University
column5: Lucknow
column6: and is approved by the All India Council for Technical Education. The college was established in 1998 and offers B.Tech courses in nine disciplines of Engineering namely Computer Science and Engineering
column8: Computer Science
column9: Computer Science & Information Technology
column10: Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning)
column11: Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
column14: Electronics and Communication Engineering
column15: Electrical and Electronics Engineering
column16: Mechanical Engineering and Civil Engineering. B.Tech programs in Computer Science and Engineering
column17: Information Technology
column18: Electronics and Communication Engineering
column19: Electrical and Electronics Engineering and Mechanical Engineering are accredited by NBA. At the post graduate level
column20: the College offers M.Tech in Electronics & Communication Engineering
column21: Computer Science
column22: Electrical and Electronics Engineering and Mechanical Engineering and the Master of Computer Applications course.\nThe college strives for excellence and has been consistently maintaining excellent academic results and placements. The college has the distinction of being the first and only college in UP to receive the Academic Excellence Award for the Best Engineering College in UPTU (now AKTU) from H.E. the Governor of UP for two successive years. It is a matter of pride for the College to maintain a superlative overall academic performance over the years with a large number of students appearing in the University Merit List every year. The College has the honor of being awarded the Chancellor’s Award for highest marks in all B.Tech courses for five consecutive years in 2015-16
column25: 2018-19 and 2019-20 since its inception in 2016.\n> Spread over 40 acre campus
column26: AKGEC has excellent infrastructure with well-planned complexes for each department having spacious laboratories
column27: class rooms equipped with state-of-the-art teaching aids
column28: department libraries and faculty cabins. Departmental laboratories have the latest equipment and relevant licensed software. The college has state-of-the-art computing facilities with over 1400 computers networked through broadband for Internet access. The college has a fully automated central library with over 1
column30: 000 books
column31: national/international journals including e-journals and multimedia resources.\nWi-Fi enabled campus includes faculty residences and three boys and three girls hostels accommodating over 1500 students. Hostels have a library
column32: TV room
column33: canteen
column34: general store
column35: well equipped gymnasium as well as indoor and outdoor sports facilities.\nIntellectual property
column36: which is reflected by the caliber of faculty
column37: is a strong point for AKGEC. The Director General
column38: Dr R.K. Agarwal is a B. Tech from IIT
column39: Kanpur
column40: MS from C.I.T.
column43: Bangalore. With such a strong intellectual capital
column44: the college fosters and encourages a teaching methodology that has both a theoretical and practical approach. The Chairman
column45: Shri Ashok Pal
column46: an engineer and eminent educationist
column47: says
column48: “The College milieu encourages every student to develop respect for established norms and values and at the same time understand the importance of technical knowledge in human development”\nThe college places special emphasis on collaboration with industries at various levels to groom the students to meet the industry standards. These include establishing collaborative facilities for student training in emerging multi disciplinary technologies and undertaking industry sponsored consultancy projects.\nThe college has the distinction of being the only Engineering College in the State of U.P. to have received approval from Department of Science and Technology (DST)
column49: Government of India
column50: for establishment of Centre of Relevance and Excellence (CORE) in the field of Automation & Robotics. The program envisages a unique partnership between AKGEC and nine international industries to promote research
column51: consultancy
column52: project development and training in the emerging technological field of Automation and Robotics.\nThe college has set up India’s first Industrial Robotic Training Centre in collaboration with Kuka Robotics of Germany. The centre is equipped with standard training cell comprising of KUKA KR-16 Industrial Robot with required auxiliary equipment and KUKA KR-5 Arc Welding Robot with MIG welding equipment and torch. In addition to this
column53: the centre offers expert level trainings in various state-of-the-art robotic applications including Robo milling
column54: Robotic CMT
column55: Robotic time twin welding
column56: Robotic ultrasonic welding
column57: Robotic vision system and spot welding etc. The centre also has a Robotics Computer Simulation Lab with software like Sim Pro and Sim Layout used to design
column58: develop and simulate robotic operations for different industrial applications. The centre provides internationally recognized certification for its Basic
column59: Advanced and Expert level training programs in this emerging technological area.\n> The College has established the first NI LabVIEW Academy in the state of U.P. in collaboration with National Instruments. The Academy is equipped with Laboratory Virtual Instrumentation Engineering Workband (LabVIEW) with built in functionality for simulation
column60: data acquisition
column61: instrument control
column62: measurement analysis
column63: data presentation and state-of-the-art Education Laboratory Virtual Instrumentation Suite (ELVIS) for training on concepts of Sensorics
column64: Mechatronics and Controls. The Academy offers courses which provide opportunity to obtain three-part NI LabVIEW certification
column65: namely CLAD
column67: that imparts broad working knowledge of the LabVIEW environment. Till now Labview Academy has conducted more than 36 training courses and trained nearly 600+ engineers. The Academy has also achieved international recognized 215 CLAD Certification (out of 1900 in the country) and 18 CLD certifications (out of 241 in the country). To recognize the spectacular outcomes consistently since last three years
column68: the academy has been selected as “Best LabVIEW Academy in India” amongest 93 academies in India. This award was given during ‘NI days 2016” conference held on 19th October
column69: 2016 at Bangalore.\nThe College has also set up the first Centre of Competence in Automation Technologies in North India in collaboration with BOSCH Rexroth AG
column70: Germany. The centre aims to train young engineering graduates of all disciplines to meet industry expectations and foster research in the multidisciplinary field of automation technologies. This centre has six laboratories equipped with state-of-the-art equipment to teach and train students and professionals in Industrial Hydraulics
column71: Pneumatics
column72: Sensorics
column73: Drives & Control
column74: CNC
column75: PLCs and Mechatronics at par with international standards.\nThe PLM Centre of Excellence set up in association with SIEMENS aims to develop engineering professionals equipped with next generation technologies. The centre provides education to the next generation of designers/engineers on software including SOLIDEDGE
column76: NX and CAD/CAM/CAE for digital product engineering
column77: Team Centre for product life cycle management and Technomatix for digital manufacturing. It addresses diverse industry segments like automotive
column78: industrial machinery
column79: industrial automation
column80: aerospace and shipbuilding.\nTo promote Industry oriented teaching learning
column81: AKGEC has setup Centre for Integrated Automation in association with Automation Industry Association (AIA). This initiative of AIA is intended to share global quality learning processes from its vast pool of member companies with chosen Engineering Colleges of our country. Industry partners namely Siemens
column82: Pepperel + Fuchs
column83: Festo and B&R have taken the lead among all industry members of AIA to support the initiative. Main objective of this Centre is to encourage engineering students to take up this multidisciplinary field as a choice of their career and get hands-on experience with latest state-of-the-art integrated automation technologies as per industry expectations.\nThe College has also set up U.P.’s first Industrial Pneumatic Knowledge Centre (IPKC) in collaboration with Janatics
column84: Coimbatore. The initiative of setting up IPKC reflects Janatics’ endeavour to contribute towards producing skilled workforce in Pneumatics which will help manufacturing sector to adopt to changes related to automation in substantive way. The IPKC also functions as National Small Industries Corporation (NSIC) Training-cum-Incubation Centre.\nAjay Kumar Garg Engineering College
column85: jointly with Fronius International GmbH has set up India’s first Advanced Welding Technology and Research Centre (AWTRC) in the state of Uttar Pradesh. AWTRC has been established with an aim of developing outstanding infrastructure for becoming a globally recognized source of a competitive workforce and cost-effective
column86: superior-performing welding technologies by conducting training
column87: research and development in the field of welding science
column88: engineering and automation technology.\nAKGEC
column89: jointly with SIEMENS
column90: has set up Advance Manufacturing Centre for SMEs and educational institutions at Ghaziabad. The AKGEC- Siemens Training Centre is setup to produce highly skilled technical manpower in the field of Advance Manufacturing. The trained manpower will help Indian Manufacturing Industry to adopt latest technologies to improve quality and work conditions with high productivity. This collaborative effort of AKGEC and industry partners has the main objective to encourage young professionals to take up this cross disciplinary field as a career of their choice and acquaint them with latest technological developments in the field of manufacturing and Reverse Engineering.\nFab Lab is an initiative of Prof. Neil Gershenfeld from MIT
column91: USA which is typically equipped with an array of flexible computer-controlled tools that cover several different length scales and various materials
column92: with the aim to make “almost anything"". AKGEC has established Fab Lab in response to the need arising from students requiring a dedicated space and appropriate equipment to develop their projects. Since then it evolved from being just a product development Centre to a facility focused on promoting innovation
column93: imparting much-needed skills for innovators and help developing competency across different disciplines including mechanical
column94: electronics and embedded development areas.\nThe efforts of the college to bridge the gap between academic curriculum and industry requirements through these centers of Excellence & Competence have been recognized and the college is the recipient of the CMAI Best Industry Interface award from the Hon’ble Minister of Science & Technology
column95: UP Govt.\nAKGEC in its endeavor to promote technical competency of engineering graduates
column96: Diploma and ITI candidates has established Skill Development Centre in collaboration with National Skill Development Corporation (NSDC)
column97: Ministry of Skill Development & Entrepreneurship
column98: Govt. of India under AKGEC Skills Foundation. This initiative is supported by reputed multinational industries of Europe like SIEMENS
column99: Fronius
column100: Messer and Carl Zeiss as per the International didactic concepts. This centre has world class State-of-the-art infrastructure and facilities to train young Engineers
column101: Polytechnic and ITI candidates in the field of Conventional and Computer Aided Manufacturing
column105: Non-Destructive Testing (NDT) and High-End Reverse Engineering processes.\nIn addition
column106: the College has established the Big Data Centre of Excellence
column107: Software Development Centre and Open Source Software Research & Development lab. These centers are run and managed entirely by the students to promote software development for the college as well as external clients
column108: conduct training programs in various technologies and host competitions.\nAs a result of these initiatives
column109: the college has been having excellent campus placements. During the current academic year
column110: over 800 students have been placed in PSUs and reputed organizations like Infosys
column119:
Indian Air Force and the Indian Army.
The main distinguishing features of the college have been uniform transparent policies and systems as well as uncompromising honesty in every facet of its activities. The college believes in setting audacious goals and infusing fresh ideas to achieve them.

content_chunk: "# Director General\n**Dr R.K. Agarwal** Director General
column3: AKGEC\nDr. R.K. Agarwal has an exceptionally brilliant academic background with B.Tech from IIT Kanpur
column5: Cranfield
column6: UK and PhD from IISc Bangalore. During his illustrious career of nearly three decades in the Indian Air Force and Defence Research & Development Organization (DRDO)\nHe has held various key appointments including Chief Engineering Officer of an Operational Base
column7: Director (Engg) at Air HQ and Project Director at Centre for Airborne Systems. His vast managerial
column8: administrative
column9: research and academic experience includes teaching assignments at Air Force Technical College and nine years of pioneering R&D work on the prestigious AWACS project in DRDO. He has also been a member of the Aeronautical Research & Development Board (ARDB) panel for approval and review of sponsored research projects at various centres of Excellence established at IITs and CSIR Laboratories.\nHe is the recipient of the coveted Royal Aeronautical Society (UK) award for academic excellence at CIT and a citation with cash award by DRDO for his contribution to the design and development of Airborne Early Warning aircraft
column10: culminating in its maiden flight. His name also features in the the book featuring “100 Great IITians: Dedicated to the Service of the Nation” by Commander V K Jately. This book will play its role of inspiring the youth of India who are on the path of making India विकसित भारत and विश्वगुरू.\nAfter taking voluntary retirement in 2004
column11: Dr. Agarwal decided to contribute in the field of technical education and has been the Director of Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College (AKGEC)
column12: Ghaziabad since then. He has been persistently working towards setting new benchmarks in academic excellence as well as industry–academia interface to make the students globally competitive and employable. During his tenure
column13: the college has not only been consistently maintaining exceptional results and placements but has also made significant progress in research and industry relevant consultancy projects. A number of initiatives and collaborative ventures with eminent multi-national companies have lead to establishment of many multi-disciplinary
column14: high technology industry relevant facilities. These include India’s first Kuka Industrial Robotics Training Centre
column15: NI-LabVIEW Academy
column16: Bosch Rexroth Centre of Competence in Automation Technologies
column17: Janatics Industrial Pneumatic Knowledge Centre and Mitsubishi Electric India. The college has also achieved the unique distinction of receiving the Academic Excellence Award for Best Engineering College in UPTU for two successive years under his able guidance.\nHe has also contributed in bringing about a culture of corporate social responsibility in academic institutions. The social activities initiated by him include running a free primary school in the college
column18: adopting a municipal corporation school in a nearby village
column19: providing tuition fee subsidy to children of class IV employees
column20: donating computers to spread computer literacy and generously contributing for relief work after natural calamities. Involvement in these activities makes the students conscious of their civic and social responsibilities. He places special emphasis on all round development with focus on inculcating self discipline

content_chunk: "# Centres Of Excellence\nAKGEC jointly with KUKA Robotics (India)
column3: has set up India’s first Industrial Robotics Training Centre for Educational Institutions at AKGEC
column4: Ghaziabad.The AKGEC-KUKA Training Centre aims to train young engineering graduates and diploma students of all engineering disciplines up to the Industry expectations and foster research in applied robotics field. The Centre offers Basic
column5: Advance and Expert level training on Industrial Robotics for Engineering and Polytechnic students. The participants receive internationally recognized joint certification by KUKA Roboter
column6: Germany and AKGEC. The manpower trained under these programs will help Indian Manufacturing industry to adopt latest technologies to improve quality and Productivity.\n###### To Know more about Robotics CoE
column7: Please Scan the QR Code \n###### For Quick Connect and Your enquiry
column8: Please Scan the QR Code\n### AKGEC-NI LABVIEW ACADEMY\nAKGEC jointly with National Instruments (India) has set up UP’s first AKGEC-NI LabVIEW Academy for Educational Institutions. The academy offers courses for all levels of LabVIEW proficiency and on various hardware platforms. These courses are intended for B.Tech students of all disciplines and provide them opportunity to obtain three-part NI LabVIEW certification named as CLAD
column9: CLD & CLA. These Certifications indicates a broad working knowledge of the LabVIEW environment and validate their skills at a professional level.To make the certifications and trainings at par with NI International standards
column10: the training contents and course material is kept same as used by NI-Labview Academy Community globally.\n###### To Know more about Robotics CoE
column11: Please Scan the QR Code \n###### For Quick Connect and Your enquiry
column12: Please Scan the QR Code\n### AKGEC – SIEMENS PLM COE\nTo develop engineering professionals equipped with next-generation technologies
column13: AKGEC jointly with SIEMENS Industry Software
column14: has setup PLM Centre of Excellence at AKGEC campus. This COE provides education to the next generation of designers/engineers on state of art software such as SOLIDEDGE
column15: NX;CAD/CAM/CAE: for digital product engineering
column16: Tem center for digital life cycle management and Techno matix for digital manufacturing This COE address diverse industry segments like automotive
column17: industrial machinery
column18: Industrial automation
column19: aerospace and shipbuilding etc.\n###### To Know more about Robotics CoE
column20: Please Scan the QR Code \n###### For Quick Connect and Your enquiry
column21: Please Scan the QR Code\n### AKGEC-BOSCH REXROTH CENTRE OF COMPETENCE IN AUTOMATION TECHNOLOGIES\nAKGEC Ghaziabad has established the Centre of Competence in Automation Technologies in collaboration with Bosch Rexroth AG
column22: Germany.The Centre has world class infrastructure with state of the art technologies
column23: equipments
column24: training kits
column25: hardware
column26: software and teaching aids with excellent faculty trained by Rexroth Germany.The center has six laboratories at par with international standard on Hydraulics
column27: Pneumatics
column28: Sensorics
column30: Drives & Control and Mechatronics. The centre aims to provide training to under graduate and post graduate students of engineering to meet industry requirements.\n###### To Know more about Robotics CoE
column31: Please Scan the QR Code \n###### For Quick Connect and Your enquiry
column32: Please Scan the QR Code\n#### AKGEC-AIA CENTER FOR INTEGRATED AUTOMATION\nAKGEC
column33: to promote Industry oriented teaching learning
column34: has setup Center for Integrated Automation in association with Automation Industry Association. This initiative of AIA is intended to share global quality learning processes from its vast pool of member companies with chosen Engineering Colleges of our country. Industry Partners namely Siemens
column36: Festo and B&R
column37:
have taken the lead among all industry members of AIA to support the initiative. Main objective of this Centre is to encourage engineering students to take up this multidisciplinary field as a choice of their career and have hands-on experience with latest state or art integrated automation technologies as per industry expectation.
For more details: _**[aia.akgecskills.in](https://aia.akgecskills.in)**_
#### AKGEC-JANATICS INDUSTRIAL PNEUMATICS
Industrial Pneumatic Knowledge Centre aims to be a world class Pneumatic Knowledge centre in India. This initiative of Janatics’ contribute towards producing skilled workforce in the field of Industrial Pneumatics which will help manufacturing sector to adopt to changes related to automation in substantive way.This is the first Centre in India exclusively focused on Industrial Pneumatics field to teach and train young engineering graduates to meet industry expectations. The centre has developed various low cost automation solutions for SMEsThe IPKC also functions as National Small Industries Corporation (NSIC) Training-cum-Incubation Centre (TIC). The primary objective of TIC is to provide an opportunity to first generation entrepreneurs to acquire necessary skills for enterprise building and also incubate them to become successful small business owners. This is the first TIC in the state of Uttar Pradesh at AKGEC.
For more details: _**[janatics.akgecskills.in](https://janatics.akgecskills.in)**_
#### AKGEC-FRONIUS ADVANCE WELDING TECHNOLOGY AND RESEARCH CENTER
Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College
column38: jointly with Fronius International GmbH has set up India’s first “Advanced Welding Technology and Research centre (AWTRC)” in the state of Uttar Pradesh.AWTRC has been established with an aim of developing state of art infrastructure for becoming a globally recognized source of a competitive workforce and cost-effective
column39: superior-performing welding technologies by conducting training
column40: research and development in the field of welding science
column41:
engineering and automation technology.
For more details: _**[fronius.akgecskills.in](https://fronius.akgecskills.in)**_
#### AKGEC-SIEMENS ADVANCE MANUFACTURING CENTRE
AKGEC
column43:
has set up Advance Manufacturing Centre for SMEs and Educational Institutions at Ghaziabad. The AKGEC- Siemens Training Centre is setup to produce highly skilled technical manpower in the field of Advance Manufacturing. The trained manpower will help Indian Manufacturing Industry to adopt latest technologies to improve quality.This collaborative effort of AKGEC and industry partners has the main objective to encourage young professionals to take up this cross disciplinary field as a career of their choice and acquaint them in the field of manufacturing and Reverse Engineering.
For more details: _**[amc.akgecskills.in](https://amc.akgecskills.in)**_
#### AKGEC-FABLAB
A fab lab is an initiative of Prof. Neil Gershenfeld from MIT
column44: USA which is typically equipped with an array of flexible computer-controlled tools that cover several different length scales and various materials
column45: with the aim to make “almost anything"".AKGEC has established Fab Lab in response to the need arising from students requiring a dedicated space and appropriate equipment to develop their projects. Since then it evolved from being just a product development center to a facility focussed on promoting innovation
column46: imparting much-needed skills for innovators and help developing competency across different disciplines including mechanical
column47: electronics and embedded development areas.This is done through providing access to tool
column48: capabilities and knowledgeable trainers and gurus who can help anyone bring their ideas to reality.The center hosts rapid prototyping tools
column49: training kits hardware and software which can be used to train on and fabricate using digital fabrication techniques. It aims to provide training to undergraduates
column50: postgraduates
column51: young kids and to engage with the local community of makers and innovators.These training and experience in digital fabrication techniques not only allows students to apply their theory in practice enhancing their learning of fundamental engineering but is also meant to cater to the need of the hour that is achieving self-sustainability through innovation and entrepreneurship.\nFor more details: _**[fablab.akgecskills.in](https://fablab.akgecskills.in)**_\n  * 27th Km Milestone

content_chunk: "# College Canteen\nThe college canteen is one of the liveliest areas of the campus. It aims at providing high-quality and nutritious food and always strives to follow high standards of cleanliness. A wide variety of food items and beverages are available at very nominal rates. The campus has 2 food outlets situated at Mechanical and CS-IT blocks respectively. Canteens remain open from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. on all working days including Saturdays.\n  * 27th Km Milestone

content_chunk: "# Faith Centre\nThe well known beauty of Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College
column3: Ghaziabad gets further enhanced with the existence of college Faith Centre. The Faith Centre of the college is built in a manner to deliver a spiritually evocative space and to accommodate its faculty
column4: staff and students. The calm ambience of the faith centre acts as enabler to generate peace of mind and concentrate on spiritual and moral well being. It has a beautifully designed hall in the centre surrounded by well maintained lawn and fountains. The faith centre is dedicated to “Maa Saraswati” commonly known as “Goddess of knowledge”. A beautiful approx six feet high idol of “Maa Saraswati” made up of white marble
column5: gives a feel of liveliness. The Dome of faith centre is architecturally similar to Lotus Temple of Delhi. The sprinkling fountains on the outer periphery of the Dome
column6: make it more lively. The Faith Centre is the heart and soul of AKGEC campus where an AKGECian can visit and witness the nature creativity.\n  * 27th Km Milestone

content_chunk: "# Hostel\nThe college provides well furnished hostel accommodation to its students. The six campus hostels are spread over four complexes namely
column5: the Junior Boys Hostel Complex and the Senior Boys Hostel Complex. The three girls hostel have double and triple seater rooms and accommodate about 600 students. The Junior Boys Hostel having double occupancy rooms can accommodate about 300 students and is reserved for first year students. The Senior Boys Hostel Complex has two hostels with single and triple seater accommodation and houses about 600 students.\nEach hostel complex has its separate mess with well equipped kitchen and dining area providing hygienic
column6: nutritious and wholesome meals. Hostels have gymnasium as well as indoor and outdoor sports facilities. The hostels also have a TV room and library with magazines and fiction / general reading books. Hostels are equipped with eco-friendly solar water heating systems. Hostels also have canteens and provision stores for minor item of daily requirement. The hostels thus provide reasonable levels of comfort
column8: recreation facilities and an environment conducive for pursuit of academic and all round development.\n### List of Amenities at a Glance\n  * Furnished rooms including Curtains
column9: Mattress
column10: Pillow
column11:
Bed Sheets
  * Clean and Hygienic – Mess & Dining
  * Internet Facility (wi fi)
  * Solar Water Heaters
  * Gymnasium


  * TV Room
  * Library
  * Indoor and Outdoor Sports Facilities
  * Canteen
  * Utility Store

content_chunk:
"# Library
Vision
To attain high standards of comprehensive services related to dissemination of required information by adoption of state-of-the-art technology thereby creating a welcoming and comfortable physical environment for the user.
Mission
We strive to provide and maintain state-of-the-art comprehensive resource center of books and journals and most efficient library service environment for dissemination of required knowledge to our faculty and students.
#### About the Library
The AKGEC Library System comprises of a Central Library
column3: eight Departmental Libraries and five Hostel Libraries. The Central Library
column4: housed in the Administrative Block of the College
column5: consists of two sections spread over 1465 Sq Mtrs with a total seating capacity for 344 users. Comfortable study space is provided for faculty
column6: staff and students in the form of reading hall
column8: digital library and faculty reading room.\nThe library system is very user friendly with sufficient resources to meet the requirements of the users. Addition of resources as per the requirements and norms is a regular feature. Sufficient numbers of qualified staff are employed to manage the activities of the library.\nThe state-of-the-art facilities include KOHA Open Source Library Management Software which also has Web Based Online Public Access Catalogue (Web OPAC)
column9: Digital Library
column10: Institutional Repository Server on DSpace software
column11: Membership to DELNET and National Digital Library.\nThe Departmental and Hostel libraries are managed and run by the respective departments and hostels with resources taken on loan from Central Library. All students
column12: faculty and staff of the College are entitled to take membership and make use of the library facilities. Admission to the Central Library is through Identity/Library Card which is scanned at the entrance to keep record of the users. The library is under camera surveillance through ten cameras that have been installed at various locations. The library attracts an average of 350 users on a regular working day.\n#### Knowledge Resources\nThe Central Library of the college has an invaluable collection of text and reference books
column13: journals and e-journals and a variety of multi-media resources. At present
column14: the total number of titles and volumes on Science
column15: Technology
column16: Humanities and Management are around nine thousand and one lac respectively. The library subscribes to over 5808 E-resources/International Journals and over 106 National Journals. The digital library has a diverse collection of over 5
column17: 700 multimedia resources. In addition
column18: the library maintains seminar reports
column19: project reports and thesis of students. A separate section with more than 1000 books on personality development and competitive examination preparation are available. All these resources are constantly getting added and increased. The Central Library also subscribes to more than 35 magazines and 12 newspapers.\n#### Library Automation\nThe Library uses KOHA software package
column20: an Open Source Library Management System
column21: to support all in-house operations of the library with barcode technology and circulation of Information through E-mail. It consists of modules on acquisition
column22: cataloguing
column23: circulation
column24: reports and Web based Online Public Access Catalogue (Web OPAC). The database of books available in the Library is updated on day-to-day basis with details of recently acquired books. Record of all the library users has also been created in the KOHA software package.\nWeb based Online Public Access Catalogue (Web OPAC) has been introduced for library data search by users. Web OPAC is a powerful search engine for finding any cataloguing information from KOHA bibliographic database on-line. The resources can be searched based on title of the book
column25: author of the book
column27:
publication or accession number of the book.
#### Library Hours
**Monday-Saturday : 8:15 AM to 9:00 PM**
**Sunday and Holidays : Closed**
**(Self reading area for students is kept open from 9 AM to 5 PM on Sunday/Holiday)**
Special arrangements are made to keep the Library open up to 12 O’clock midnight before and during the minor and major examinations.
#### Digital Library
The Digital Library provides visual media in all formats to support teaching and research. The collection includes DVDs and CD-ROMs for use by AKGEC faculty
column28: staff and students within the library. The collection is constantly being updated and expanded to address the specific study and research needs of the AKGEC community. There are 15 multimedia PCs for use on a walk-in basis in the Digital Library. Users can access Digital Library from anywhere in the campus through IP. An online catalogue of CDs / DVDs is also available for their reference.\nThe Institutional Repository DSpace has been recently installed to facilitate the users to access multiple resources like e-Journals
column30: news paper clippings and administrative norms / policies of the college.\nThe library subscribes to a variety of e-journals including Wiley Engineering e-Journals
column31: Wiley Management e-Journals
column32: Springer Nature e-Journals
column33: Taylor & Francis e-Journals
column34: Gale e-Journals
column36: ELSEVIER Science Direct
column37: Emerald Management E-Journals. In addition
column38: the library is a member of DELNET
column39:
National Digital Library and Institution of Engineers India for access to a variety of articles and books. The following e- resources are subscribed by the Institute:
**E-Journals:**
**S. No.** | **Publication** | **Subject Areas** | **Access**  
---|---|---|---  
1. | Wiley Engineering e-Journals | ME+EC+CS&IT+CE & other Engineering Branches | 200 E-Journals  
2. | Wiley Management e-Journals | Applied Science (Business Management) | 250 E-Journals  
3. | Springer Nature e-Journals | Applied Science (Physics
column40: Chemistry

column44: Management & Economics | Business
column45: Management & Economics | 128 E-Journals  \n6. | Gale: Pharmacy Collection e-Journals | Pharmacy Collection e-Journals | Title counts: Total titles=827; Total Journals / Magazine = 770
column46: Refereed/ Peer-reviewed=689

column48: with embargo = 26 titles)

column51: E-Journals & Magazines  \n8. | EBSCO: Art & Architecture Source Database Coverage – E-Journals & E-Magazines | Art & Architecture Source Database Coverage – E-Journals & E-Magazines | 1818 Databases
column52: E-Journals & Magazines  \n9. | ELSEVIER : Science Direct Engineering E-Journals | EC+CS&IT & other Engineering Branches | 296 E-Journals  \n10. | Emerald: Management E-Journals | Business
column53: Management & Economics | 212 E-Journals  \n11. | DELNET | General Engineering & Reference | Access Millions of Networked Library Resources: 5

Humanities etc.

column97: Humanities etc.  \n**Total:** | **14
column98: 593+ E-books**  \n#### Reference Section\nThe Central Library maintains a separate reference section consisting of text books
column99: reference books
column102: dictionaries and competitive books for GATE
column104: GRE and GMAT. One copy of each title of Books is kept in Not-For-Issue (NFl)/Reserved Section for the reference of the users within the library only. The Reference Section resources may be issued
column106:
for overnight after permission from the Senior Librarian.
Reference staff is also available in the reference section/reading section to suggest sources of information and to assist in locating the required resources.
Reference Section hosts sitting area which includes 9 cubicles with each cubicle having seating for 4 students provides privacy without any disturbance to other students.
#### Periodical Section
The Central Library subscribes to National and International journals as per AICTE norms in electronic as well as print form in the fields related to science
column109: management and humanities. Besides the current journals library also maintains a rich collection of old journals. All latest journals can be referred within the library. E-journals including Wiley Engineering e-Journals
column116: Emerald Management E-Journals can be accessed in the Digital Library which is equipped with computer systems and multimedia facility.\n#### Book Bank\nIn addition to well maintained Circulation and Reference Sections
column117: the college has a rich Book Bank exclusively for students. The Book Bank is very helpful in fulfilling students’ requirements for the University prescribed text books on semester basis without spending much on it.\nThe Book Bank
column120: assists the students by issuing text books on loan for the whole academic semester according to the rules framed for the purpose. Under this scheme every student is issued on loan a set of one or two books for each subject for the full semester. The books are required to be returned at the end of each semester and a set of books is issued at the beginning of next semester.\nA compactor storage system has been installed recently to provide increased storage
column121: easy access / retrieval and protection from dust etc of large number of books of Book Bank.\n#### Library Membership\nThe students
column122: faculty and staff of the College can register themselves for the membership of the Library. The users are issued bar-coded cards. Their entitlements
column123: in terms of the number of books that can be borrowed by them
column124:
are as follows:
  * **Faculty members :** Two books for semester and three books for a month
  * **Staff members :** Two books for a month
  * **PG students :** Three books for a month
  * **UG students :** Two books for ten days


Two extra books are provided to the eligible students for one month under the Social Welfare Scheme.
#### Extra book Facility for Toppers
A special facility is provided to the meritorious students in the form of issue of three extra books for one month.
#### Book Reservation
In case of non-availability of the desired book in the library the book can be noted and reserved for the user and issued as soon as other user returns the book.
#### Institutional Membership/ Inter Library Loan
The Central Library offers inter-library loan service to its users for the books and periodicals not available in the AKGEC Library by procuring them from other libraries. The AKGEC library has membership of DELNET and National Digital Library which facilitate sharing of resources among member libraries.
DELNET has been established with the prime objective of promoting resource sharing among the libraries through the development of a network of libraries. Members of AKGEC Central Library can utilize this facility through central library. The resources available under DELNET network include Union Catalogue of Books and Periodicals and database of thesis and dissertations.
National Digital Library (NDL)
column125: coordinated by IIT Kharagpur and sponsored by MHRD
column126: has 6.5 million resources available on a single portal where resources can be read online or downloaded. The resources include text books and audio and video content.\n#### Departmental Libraries\nThere are eight departmental libraries which have collection of subject books
column127: project reports and old issues of journals relating to their Branch. The resources are provided on loan from the Central Library on semester basis. The departmental libraries are open for use by faculty members and are managed by the respective departments.\n#### Hostel Libraries\nThe five Hostel Libraries
column128: two in girls’ hostels and three in boys’ hostels
column132: personality development and motivational reading. These libraries also maintain newspapers and magazines. Hostel libraries are managed by the students who are paid suitable remuneration.\n#### True Reader Award\nWith the aim to encourage students to use the library regularly and inculcate good reading habits
column133: “True Reader Award” has been introduced. The award
column135: is given to top-user students who use the Central Library for at least 25 hours over minimum 10 days after college hours.\n#### Earn While You Learn\nUnder the very successful scheme of Earn While You Learn
column136: students are encouraged to work in the library to support the library staff in activities such as book labeling
column138: newspaper clipping records and digital library maintenance. The students work after college hours and are paid remuneration for their services. Their dedication and enthusiasm is exhibited in the effectiveness of their gaining confidence of learning the working mechanisms of library administration.\n#### Additional Facilities\n**News Paper Clippings :** Clippings of the latest news related to college events
column140: AKTU and other Engineering Colleges are maintained on daily basis for ready reference purposes.\n**Reprographic Services :** The Reprographic Services are extended through an external outfit which operates within Central Library premises for easy access by users. The services include photocopying
column142: print outs and spiral binding.\n**College Event Photographs :** Event wise photographs are maintained for easy and ready availability of photographs for students.\n**Laptop Charging Point
column143:
Internet Connecting Point and Wi-Fi :** These arrangements facilitate uninterrupted usage of student laptops to allow them work for longer durations.
**Faculty Reading Area :** A separate space has been provided in the reference section for usage by faculty members.
#### Library Staff
The library has well qualified
column144:
experienced and friendly staff who are always willing to offer their best services at all times.
Prof. I P Sharma | Dean Library  
---|---  
Dr. Shiv Shankar Srivastava | Senior Librarian  
Ms. Kavita Kulshreshtha | Assistant Librarian  
Mr. Ram Abhilash | Library Assistant  
Mr. Dinesh Kumar | Library Assistant  
Mr. Shobhit Kumar Sharma | Library Assistant  
Mr. Rajkumar Sharma | Library Assistant  
Mr. Balkishan | Book Lifter  
Mr. Rajeev Sharma | Book Lifter  
Mr. Ratan Singh | Library Attendant  
Mr. Brijender Singh | Library Attendant  
#### Catalogue Search / OPAC
Catalogue search / Online Public Access Catalogue (Web OPAC) has been introduced for library data search by users
column145:
OPAC is a powerful search engine for finding any cataloguing information from Koha bibliographic database on-line.
The resources can be searched based on:
  1. Title of the book
  2. Author of the book
  3. Publication
  4. Subject
  5. Accession Number of the book. etc.


#### Rules and Regulations for the Library Users
  * Library users must show their Identity cum library card at the security point. In case
column146: the member does not possess his/her identity card
column147: he/she is not permitted to enter the library.\n  * Personal belongings like bags
column149:
etc. are not allowed inside the library in any case.
  * Identity cum library cards is non-transferable. Use of other’s library card is a punishable conduct. The borrower as well as authorized holder of the card may be punished for such an act.
  * Library hours are 8:30 AM – 9:00 PM on working days and during examination period library hours are extended till 12:00 midnight. Books are issued from 8:45 AM to 3:45 PM only. Reservation of books is made between 8:45 AM to 3:30 PM only.
  * Return of books after the due date will attract a fine of Rs.5/- per day per volume. The amount of fine would not exceed double the cost of the book.
  * In case of late Issue of Book Bank Books Rs. 5/- is charged per day for delayed collection from scheduled date limited upto Rs. 50/-. List of defaulters is sent to respective HoD’s after one week and submitted to Director after 10 days. 
  * Reference books are issued only under special circumstances with prior permission of Senior Librarian/Asst. Librarian between 3:15 PM to 3:45 PM for overnight. Deposition of the reference book should be made positively on the next day up to 10:00 AM
column150:
failing which a fine of Rs.20/- is charged for each day. The user who does not deposit the reference book in time is treated as defaulter and refrained from issue of reference book in future.
  * Question Papers & Solutions and other library materials are issued for Xerox for an hour only; late submission attracts a fine of Rs.2/- per hour per document.
  * Borrowers must check the condition of the book before borrowing; they are responsible for any damage or mutilation noticed at the time of return.
  * Leaving circulation counter without ensuring that the book(s) have been returned is a punishable conduct. For doing so a fine of Rs. 50/- is charged even if book is traced later on.
  * No book is renewed/re-issued on same day.
  * If a book is already issued to a student
column151: another copy of the same book cannot be issued to or reserved for him/her.\n  * The latest edition of book is only accepted in replacement of a lost/damaged book along with a fine of Rs.50/- as processing fee. If the book is not available in the market / publisher
column152: double the cost of book is charged. \n  * Misplacing/marking/tearing of books is punishable offence. Any user caught for such offence would be fined Rs.1000/- and may even lead to withdrawal of library facility to him/her.\n  * If any student is caught stealing from the library
column153:
a fine of Rs. 2000/- is imposed on him/her in addition to suitable disciplinary action.
  * Disciplinary action is taken against Library users found misbehaving with the library staff. 
  * The loss of Identity card/library membership card is to be informed immediately to the Senior Librarian.
  * For duplicate Identity card (in case of lost card)
column154:
the student has to make a written request to the Director and has to deposit a fine of Rs.300/- for duplicate card. A fine of Rs.100/- is to be paid as the processing fee for the replacement of ragged/damaged PVC Identity card or taking Identity card very late.
  * Timing for other library services has been fixed which are subjected to change in the interest of the library users.
  * Library users must ensure that their activities do not disturb the fellow users.

content_chunk:
"# Vision And Mission
OUR VISION
To introduce undergraduate and postgraduate courses for all engineering branches and award of Ph.D degree to be one of the best engineering colleges in the country and to be a deemed university.
OUR MISSION
We strive to provide and maintain academic environment and systems
column3: enabling maximum learning to produce competent professionals. We also aim at achieving this through transparent academic and administrative policies in the college. We intend to provide conducive atmosphere for research
column4:
development and consultancy services to our faculty at national and international level.
OUR QUALITY POLICY
To provide and continually improve academic environment and systems which give total satisfaction and enable students to develop their full potential and mature into competent professionals and responsible members of society.
  * 27th Km Milestone

content_chunk: "# Educational Verification\nPlease visit ‘Services’ link on home page of the University website [(www.aktu.ac.in)](https://aktu.ac.in/) for verification of educational details of our students.\nIn case of any problem or inordinate delay in response from University
column3:
the following guidelines should be followed:
Please mail the final year marksheet and / or degree certificate of the concerned student(s) along with request for verification at following e-mail id: [registrar@akgec.ac.in](http://registrar@akgec.ac.in/)
You will be replied through e-mail within three working days of the College.
In case of non-reply from the College within stipulated time frame
column4: please inform to Dr. Shraddha Dixit
column5: Registrar at her mobile no. 9818391726 between 10 am to 4 pm except on Saturdays
column6: Sundays and public holidays.\n  * 27th Km Milestone

content_chunk:
"# Issuance of certificates for passout students
Documents required to be submitted at the College for issuance of various certificates to the Passout students
### 
  1. Photocopy of the Final year marksheet.
  2. No dues certificate from the Accounts Section.


### 
  1. Photocopy of the Final year marksheet.
  2. Photocopy of the 10th pass certificate.
  3. A receipt of Rs. 50/- as processing fee from the Accounts Section.
  4. No dues certificate from the Accounts Section.


### 
  1. Apply online on AKTU website (Link: https://erp.aktu.ac.in/WebPages/Public/Students/Dashboard.aspx)


### 
  1. ID- Proof (issued by the Govt.) of the concerned student.
  2. No dues certificate from the Accounts Section.
  3. In absence of student
column3:
the parents/guardian may collect the degree certificate subject to submission of their Id-proof (issued by the Govt.) and authority letter given by the concerned student.


**Most Important:**
The Students must collect their T.C. and Character Certificate within one month from the date of application (online and offline). Those failing to collect the certificates within above said time-frame
column4: may collect the same in next one month after paying a fine of Rs. 200/-. The certificates not collected within two months from the date of application shall be cancelled and can be re-applied for. In such a case
column5: both certificates can be obtained on payment of Rs. 500/-.\n  * 27th Km Milestone

content_chunk: "# Policy and Process for Refund of Caution Money\nThe caution money and security deposit are refundable after deduction of dues
column4: only after the student finally leaves the College on completion of the course.\nEach student
column5: studying in the final year of his/her course
column6: is required to fill up clearance form (No Dues Form) and submit the same to the Accounts Office
column7: before leaving the College. The Accounts Office processes the forms and distributes the cheques of caution money at the time of College Convocation. For this the students are individually informed through letters and e-mails. Majority of the caution money cheques are distributed in one go in a single day through the aforesaid process. Those students who fail to attend the Convocation Ceremony may collect their cheques on any other working day during College hours.\n  * 27th Km Milestone
column8: Delhi-Meerut Expressway
column9: P.O. Adhyatmik Nagar
column10:
Ghaziabad - 201015

content_chunk: "# AICTE Nomination\nAICTE in its endeavour to bring reform in technical education has constituted various committees for developing model curriculum with the help of academic and industry experts for undergraduate degree courses in Engineering & Technology which will be available for universities and institutions.\nRecently
column3: AICTE has constituted a committee duly approved by Chairman
column4: All India Board of Under Graduate Studies in Engineering & Technology (AIB-UGET) to develop model curricula of Mechatronics Engineering. Prof. Ashiv Shah from AKGEC has been nominated as member in this committee along with Prof. Sunil Jha of IIT Delhi and Prof. Agashe of COEP Pune from Academia and Mr. Vikram Mattoo
column5: General Manager
column6: Mitsubishi from Industry.\n  * 27th Km Milestone
column8: P.O. Adhyatmik Nagar

content_chunk: "# College Awards\nWe are proud to announce that Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College (AKGEC)
column3: Ghaziabad has been honored with the prestigious Diamond Rating by QS I-GAUGE.\nThis recognition highlights our steadfast dedication to academic excellence
column5: and holistic development across all institutional parameters. The Diamond Rating stands as a testament to the relentless efforts of our visionary leadership
column6: committed faculty
column8: and supportive stakeholders. This milestone marks yet another step forward in our journey toward educational distinction.\n### Accreditation of Measurement and Metrology Centre by National Accreditation Board for Testing and Calibration Laboratories (NABL)\nAjay Kumar Garg Engineering College
column9: in its endeavor to impart engineering education commensurate with the requirements of Industries
column10: have established a world class Measurement & Metrology Centre in collaboration with Zeiss. It is equipped with 3D Coordinate Measuring Machine (CMM)
column11: Surface Roughness Testing
column13: along with the regular measuring instruments and accessories. The facility has now been accredited by National Accreditation Board for Testing and Calibration Laboratories (NABL) as per ISO / IEC 17025:2017 standard
column14: complying with “General Requirements for the Competence of Testing & Calibration Laboratories.”\nNational Accreditation Board for Testing and Calibration Laboratories (NABL)
column15: aconstituent Board of Quality Council of India has been established with the objective of providing Government
column16: Industry Associations and Industry in general with a scheme of Conformity Assessment Body’s accreditation which involves third-party assessment of the technical competence of testing including medical and calibration laboratories
column17: proficiency testing providers and reference material producers. It is a full member (MRA signatory) to International Laboratory Accreditation Co-operation (ILAC) as well as Asia Pacific Laboratory Accreditation Co-operation (APLAC) since 2000 on the basis of peer evaluation by APLAC as per ISO/IEC 17011:2004.\nThe centre is now authorized to provide Internationally valid dimension testing / calibration results as per the scope approved by NABL. With this recognition
column18: the measurement and metrology centre at AKGEC joins one of the very few elite laboratories setup by an Engineering Institute
column19: to be accredited by NABL in the country. The centre now looks forward to offer the services in Dimension Metrology to the nearby Industries and Research Organizations.\n### Patent for 3-D printer\nAKGEC attainted patent for 3-D Printer developed by Mr. Pradeep Jain
column20: Associate Professor
column21: Department of Mechanical Engineering
column22: under the aegis of Research and Industrial Consultancy Centre
column23: AKGEC.\nThe printer uses a method of manufacturing known as Additive Manufacturing due to the fact that instead of removing material to create a part
column24: the process adds material in successive patterns to create the desired shape.\n### AICRA 2020 Awards - India STEM College Award and Best Robolab Setup\nAKGEC has been honored with STEM Award-2020 under India STEM College Award 2020 and Best Robolab Setup during 3rd edition of STEM Contribution Awards & Summit -2020 organized by the All India Council for Robotics & Automation (AICRA) India on 13 February
column25: 2020.\nDr. R K Agrawal
column27: and Prof Ashiv Shah
column28: Head TIFAC Core
column29: AKGEC received the award from the council on behalf of the college. This is the third consecutive year for AKGEC to be honored at STEM Awards & Summit.\n### AICRA 2019 Award for Excellence and Innovation in Robotics Education\nAKGEC has been awarded for Excellence and Innovation in the Robotics Education by All India Council for Robotics & Automation (AICRA)
column30: India during 2nd edition of STEM Contribution Awards & Conference-2019 at IIT Delhi on 16th April
column31: 2019. Dr. R K Agarwal
column32: Director AKGEC
column33: received the award.\nProf. V. Ramgopal Rao
column34: Chairman & Director– IIT Delhi and Mr. R. Ramanan
column36: Atal Innovation Mission
column37: Niti Ayog addressed the gathering. Conference was participated by eminent Academia and Industry active in STEM education.\n### AICRA 2018 Awards for Best Technology Infrastructure of the Year and Best Vocational Robotics Educational Centre\nAKGEC
column38: in its endeavor to promote excellence in engineering education and imparting high end technical training programs
column39: has been honored with the two awards – Best Technology Infrastructure of the Year Award 2018 and Best Vocational Robotics Education Award 2018. The awards were conferred by All India Council for Robotics & Automation (AICRA) and Ministry of Science & Technology
column40: Govt. of India along with media partner TimesNow during ceremony held at STEM Summit & Awards-2018 on Education and Technology Industry at NDMC Convention Centre
column42: 2018.\n### NAFEMS UK -2018 Award for Best Industry Institute Interaction\nAKGEC in recognition of its endeavor to promote excellence in engineering education through Industry-Institute association leading to contemporary careers for engineering students
column43: has been honored with Best Industry Institute Interaction Award. The award was presented by NAFEMS Chief Executive Mr. Tim Morris during the NAFEMS 18th International Conference on 21st July
column44: 2018 at Bangalore. The award was received by Dr. R.K Agarwal
column45: Director
column46: AKGEC and Prof. Ashiv Shah
column47: Head CORE during ceremony organized as part of the Newton Bhabha – Industry Academic Partnership Project of the Royal Academy of Engineering
column48: UK. NAFEMS
column49: UK is the global body with focus on engineering analysis and simulation.\n### Dialogue India 2018 Award for Best Private Engineering College in North India\nKeeping the legacy of achievements forward
column50: AKGEC Ghaziabad achieved the Dialogue India Award-2018 on 19 May
column51: 2018 during a scintillating evening at IIT Delhi. The College has been awarded as “Best Private Engineering College in North India"". The award was given during 4th Dialogue India Academia Conclave held in association with the Design Department of IIT along with an exhibition on innovative designs.\n### Best LabVIEW Academy Award by National Instruments\nAKGEC-NI was awarded the Best LabVIEW Academy in India for Excellent Performance and Innovation in Education on 19 October
column52: 2016 during Annual Award Ceremony of National Instruments (NI) at Hotel ITC Gardenia
column53: Bangalore.\nTill date this academy has trained over 600 plus engineers on LabVIEW and has accomplished placement opportunities for its students on Test
column54: Measurement and Control. In a short span of four years
column55: the academy has carved a niche position. The academy has also achieved widely recognized 204 CLAD certifications and 17 CLD certifications.\n### Best Institution for Innovation Award\nIt is a matter of pride for AKGEC to have received the award for Best Institution for Innovation from Entrepreneurship and Skill Development Association at National Summit on Industry–Academia Integration and Awards held at PHD Chamber of Commerce
column56: New Delhi
column57: on 22 August
column58: 2015. Prof. Shivakant Ojha
column59: Hon’ble Minister of Technical Education
column60: Government of U.P.
column61: Shri Vijay Goel
column62: Hon’ble Member of Parliament
column63: Rajya Sabha and Prof. Vinay Pathak
column64: Vice Chancellor
column65: Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam Technical University
column66: Lucknow graced the occasion with their benign presence.\n### Emerging LabVIEW Academy Award by National Instruments\nAKGEC was honored with the Emerging LabVIEW Academy in North India 2014 Award by National Instruments
column67: USA during NI Days on 30 September
column68: 2014 at ITC Gardenia
column69: Bangalore.\n### Best Institute Award by CMAI \nAKGEC has been awarded for its best Industry-Institute Interface
column70: Hon’ble Shri Abhishek Mishra
column71: Minister of Science & Technology
column72: U.P Government on 19 August
column73: 2013 at JSS Academy of Technical Education
column74: Noida during National UP Educational Awards-2013 organized by CMAI Association of India and supported by Mahamaya Technical University
column76: AICTE
column77: Government of India.\n### Dialogue India Academia Award-2013 for First Rank in Engineering Colleges affiliated to Mahamaya Technical University (MTU)
column78: Noida\n### Academic Excellence Award by UPTU\nAKGEC has been recipient of Academic Excellence Award from Uttar Pradesh Technical University for three consecutive years in 2008
column79:
2009 and 2010
  * Superior Overall Performance Adjudged By Uttar Pradesh Technical University (UPTU) in 2008
  * Best Engineering College Award by Ghaziabad Management Association In 2008
  * Appreciation Letter By Uttar Pradesh Technical University (UPTU) in 2007 For Excellent Performance In B.Tech 1st Semester
  * Appreciation Letter by Uttar Pradesh Technical University (UPTU) for Very Good Performance In 2007 in B.Tech 3rd Semester
  * Appreciation Letter by Uttar Pradesh Technical University (UPTU) as “Most Appreciated Institution Of UPTU Who Can Ensure 100% Results And Quality Of Academic Achievements” in 2005

content_chunk: "# Student Awards (Extra Curricular)\n### \nWe are thrilled to announce our students’ outstanding performance at the AKTU Literary
column5: held at KIET on 27th–28th November 2024.They won silver medals in 10 events
column6: including Robo Race
column8: Debate
column9: INNO Quest
column10: and Turbo AI Challenge
column11: and bronze medals in Declamation and Ad Mad Show
column12: earning medals in every event they participated in. Congratulations to our talented students for their dedication
column14: and exceptional achievements!\n### \nThe MIRAZ'24 (Rann-Neeti'24)
column15: a sports event
column16: was hosted at the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT)
column17: Mandi
column18: from April 12th to April 14th
column19: 2024. The event aimed to unite talented athletes from various institutes across the nation to compete in a variety of sports disciplines. Our college's Volleyball (Boys & Girls)
column20: Table Tennis (Boys & Girls)
column21: Athletics (Boys & Girls)
column22: Football (Boys)
column23: Cricket (Boys)
column24: and Basketball (Girls) teams participated in this tournament. Remarkably
column25: the AKGEC sports team clinched an impressive tally of 17 Gold
column27: and 8 Bronze medals
column28: securing the overall champions trophy at the second position. Additionally
column29: they achieved the overall Athletics trophy at the first position
column30: showcasing their exceptional sporting prowess and dedication.\n### \nNetaji Subhash Sports Complex
column31: Sarita Vihar has been setup by Delhi Government as Sports Academy.\nOur twelve member Kho-Kho college team participated in the Athleema Sports Tournament`2023’ organised by Asian Education Group (AEG) and held from 04/04/2023 to 07/04/2023. We were very proud to represent our college in this tournament among various other prestigious institutions participating with more than 3000 participants in various sports like kabaddi
column32: cricket
column33: football etc. Prince Narula who is a famous Indian Television Actor was the Chief Guest during inauguration.\nThere were total eight teams participating in Kho-Kho tournament. The matches were held in knockout format. Our first match was scheduled with ASB
column34: Noida on 04/03/2023 at 3:00 pm that we won by a large margin with the score being 17 (AKGEC)- 01(ASB) in the first round and they accepted defeat without playing second round. Our Second match was scheduled against AAFT
column35: Noida on 05/03/2023 at 1:00 pm that we won easily with the score being 12(AKGEC)- 03(AAFT) in the first round and in the second round they scored 04 (AAFT) only. We won and were placed in the finals.\nOur final match against IIMT
column36: Noida on 06/04/2023 at 2:00 PM that we won easily with the score being 17(AKGEC)- 06 (IIMT) in the first round and in the second round they scored 08 (IIMT) only and with that we won the match and the Kho-Kho championshipClosing ceremony was held on 7/04/23 at Asian Law College (Noida).We received certificates
column37: medals with cash prize.\n### \nAn Eight-member volleyball team of our college from B. tech 3rd and 4th year participated in Malviya sports Tournament 2023 held at MNIT
column38: Jaipur w.e.f. 23/3/23 to 25/3/23. The tournament was inaugurated by Shri Ram Kumar Sehrawat a former Indian basketball player and coach of junior Indian team as Chief Guest.\nIt was a proud moment that we were selected to participate as one among ten teams from various prestigious Institutes. The ten teams were divided on four pools and the matches were held on league cum knockout basis.\nOur first league match was held with University College of Engineering and Technology (UCET
column39: Bikaner) who were the champions of last year’s Malviya Sports Tournament. So
column40: we were pitted against a very strong team
column42: we played well and to the best of our ability but lost by a close margin in a best of 3 games with the score being 25(AKGEC)-27(UCET) in the first set and 23(AKGEC)-25(UCET) in the second set. As four of our very good players from B. tech 2nd year could not join because of their End Semester University Exams
column43: the result would have been different and in all probability a victory in our favour.\nThe Second league match was to be played against NIT
column44: Uttarakhand who did not turn up and we got a “walkover” victory. As a result
column45: we were declared runners up of our pool. However
column46: overall championship of the game was won by MNIT
column47: Jaipur with UCET
column48:
Bikaner as the runners up.
We are very thankful to our director Dr. R.K. Agarwal for allowing us to participate in this prestigious tournament. We are also thankful to our DSW Prof. V.K. Parashar and Sports Officer Mr. Pratap Singh for supporting as well as motivating us to participate in the tournament. This tournament provided us with new experience and strategies to work on our sport which will help us to perform better in the upcoming AKTU zonal and states tournament.

column189: MOHAN NAGAR TOURNAMENT REPORT\nOur College Cricket Team participated in Inter-Institute Cricket Tournament 2018 held from 13th to 16th March
column191: Mohan Nagar. On the first day
column193: our Team faced the home team
column194: ITS in their first match. AKGEC batted first and set a target of 130 for the opponent team in 15 overs. Finally
column195: they all got out (the ITS team) at 86 and emerged victorious in the first match. This led to the qualification for Semi-Finals.\nThe semi-final was played against SGIT on 15/03/18. SGIT batted first and were thrashed at a score of 64. Our college team very easily achieved the target in 8 overs and won the match by 9 wickets
column196: qualifying for the Finals.\nThe final match was played on 16/03/18 against JHNIT. Our team batted first and scored 126 runs in 16 overs. The struggle was real
column197: but unfortunately the opponent team won the match in 11.2 overs. Finally JHNIT came out to be the winners; Our team was the Runner-Up. A cash prize of Rs.5100 was awarded as the Runner-Up award along with Runner-up Trophy

Boys teams also played well but were pitted against strong teams from Punjab / Haryana. Winners were given medals & certificates whereas all participants were presented with a T-Shirt each.

"# Student Achievements (Technical)
### 
“30Hacks” Hackathon organised by Hitachi x GlobalLogic
Team VidyutKavach from Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College was recently selected to participate in the “30Hacks"" Hackathon organized by Hitachi x GlobalLogic. The event took place on March 14th and 15th
column3: 2024. The team successfully advanced to the Finale Round and emerged as the First Prize winner in the “Sustainable Energy Solutions"" category
column4: earning a reward of Rs. 4 Lakh. Additionally
column5: they received internship offers and the opportunity to showcase their business idea
column6: potentially securing funding in exchange for equity. Their project
column8: is a Cyber-Secure Web-Based Energy Management System that employs a multi-layered strategy to ensure security and integrity. This includes utilizing an MQTT broker server for IoT authentication
column9: Network-Based Signature IDPS
column10: Host-Based Heuristic IDPS
column11: and SOAR. It's worth noting that the students intend to pursue this project as a startup.\nShankara Global Hackathon at Shankara Group of Institutions
column12: Jaipur\nTeam VidyutKavach from Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College has been selected for the “Shankara Global Hackathon"" organized by Shankara Group of Institutions
column14: held on March 1st and 2nd
column16: saw Mr. Anuj Kumar
column17: Assistant Professor of CSE
column18: serving as the faculty mentor for Team VidyutKavach. The student members of this project include Shashwat Singh (CSE(DS))
column19: Gracy Gupta (CS)
column20: Utkarsh Singh (CSE)
column21: Rohit Somvanshi (CSE(DS))
column22: Mohd Anas Khan (CSE)
column23: and Shifa Saeed (CSE(DS)). The team excelled
column24: advancing to the Final Round and clinching the First Prize for “Most Innovative Idea

content_chunk: "# Branch Toppers\n### \nIt is a matter of immense pleasure that nine students of AKGEC from I
column3: II and III year of B.Tech have secured positions at University level among the branch-wise list of Top-2 students for the session 2018-19 as published by the University. This is the highest tally of position holders from any Government or Private College affiliated to the University. content_chunk:
"# Conferences 2019-20
### 
**About the Conference:**
Department of Electronics & Communication Engineering organized two Days National Conference on Emerging Trends in Electronics & Communication-2019 (ETEC-2019) from 5-6 February
column3: 2019. Emerging technologies of Electronics & Communication does not only satisfy the growing demands of end users but also poses several challenges to the researchers. Thus
column4: the main objective of this conference (ETEC-2019) is to provide a platform for researchers
column5: industry experts and faculty of various engineering colleges to share their ideas/ research work over the latest developments in this field\nUndoubtedly
column6: Electronics & Communication has crept into every sphere of human life e.g.
column8: computers
column9: internet
column10: mobile phones and even the high-end satellites
column11: thus increasing its scope manifolds for mankind. The resource personnel for this conference were accomplished experts from organizations like ITU
column14: BSNL
column15: IITs
column16: NSIT
column17:
DTU etc.
The resource personnel for this conference were accomplished experts from various organizations. The details are given below:
**S. No.** | **Panellist Name** | **Designation** | **E-mail ID**  
---|---|---|---  
**Inaugural Session** **(05 February 2019
column18: Tuesday)
column19: 10 A.M to 12.30 P.M**  \n1 |  **Mr. Kuldeep Goyal** (**Chief Guest**) | Telecommunications Consultant & Former Chairman & Managing Director
column20: BSNL | kuldeep_goyal@yahoo.com  \n2 |  **Mr. Bharat Bhatia** (**Guest of Honour**) |  Head of International Spectrum team at MOTOROLA Solutions
column21: Government Affairs Public Protection &| Disaster Relief (PPDR)
column22: Spectrum Management & ICT Policies & Regulations | bharat.bhatia@itu-apt.org  \n3 |  **Mr. Jitendra Singh** (**Keynote Speaker**) |  Senior Director
column23: Government Affairs
column24: Qualcomm (India & South Asia) |  jitendra@qti.qualcomm.com  \n**Technical Session – I – Wireless Communication** **(05 February 2019
column25: Tuesday) 1:30 P.M. to 3:30 P.M.**  \n4 | **Wg. Cdr (Retd.) Arif Ullah Khan** |  CEO
column26: Chrishall T-Sec Solutions New Delhi | arifukhan2@gmail.com  \n5 | **Mr. Vikas Nigam** | Asst. Director
column27: ALTTC | nigamvikas06@gmail.com  \n**Technical Session – II – Antenna and Microwave Communication** **(06 February 2019
column28: Wednesday) 9 A.M. to 11 A.M.**  \n6 | **Dr. Sanjeev Yadav** | Asst. Prof. Women Engg. College Ajmer | sanjeev.yadav@gweca.ac.in  \n7 | **Mr. Amit Tiwari** | Project Manager

column38: KEC Ghaziabad | achyuta.mishra@krishnacollege.ac.in  \n### \nDepartment of Mechanical Engineering AKGEC organized the conference Mechanical and Automation Engineering (MAAE-2020)
column39: during 7-8 February 2020. The aim of the conference was to provide a knowledge sharing platform for researchers
column40: academicians and industry personnel. The conference also provided an opportunity to students to get exposed to the culture of academic development and to the field of research and innovation.\nResearch papers were invited on topics including Unconventional Manufacturing

column47: Concurrent Engineering
column48: Simulation and Modelling and more.\nThe patrons and organizers were honored to have senior academicians from IITs

Shera made note of his illustrious career at the Indian Air Force and pointed out the opportunities and challenges that engineers can find in a career at the IAF. Vision
Our vision is to expand our first year students’ horizon of knowledge by exposing them to holistic education as well as enhancing their English Language competence. Department of Applied Sciences and Humanities will become a centre of excellence in teaching and research
column7:
and a natural benchmark for other organizations to measure themselves against.

""Setting first-year engineering students up for success""
To deliver a unique first year broad based experience that emphasizes hands-on-learning

"# Civil Engineering
[ Faculty ](https://www.akgec.ac.in/ce-faculty/)
[ Labs ](https://www.akgec.ac.in/ce-labs/)
[ Achievements ](https://www.akgec.ac.in/ce-achievements/)
