**B. Tech. Civil Engineering 30**
Civil Engineering is the art of directing the sources of power in nature for the use and convenience of man
column3: for improvement of quality of life. The theory and practice of Civil Engineering is basically applied in the construction of buildings & structures
column5: bridges
column6: aqueducts
column8: river navigation ports
column9: docks and harbours.At AKGEC
column10: B.Tech course in Civil Engineering is offered with intake capacity of 60.The goal of the department is to produce high quality technical manpower needed by industry
column11: R&D organizations and academic institutions and above all to meet the engineering needs of the nation.The faculty comprises of galaxies of qualified and experienced teachers with Ph.D and M Tech from premier institutions like IITs and NITs.\nThe academic activities of the Department emphasize deep understanding of fundamental principles
column12: development of creative ability to handle the challenges of Civil Engineering and the analytical ability to solve problems which are interdisciplinary in nature.The Department also encourages its students to engage in extra-curricular and co-curricular activities
column13: essential for development and nurturing of team spirit
column14:
developing organizational skills and inculcating good moral values and positive work culture.
### 
Vision
To produce professionally competent
column15: socially sensitive
column16: motivated and dedicated Civil Engineers capable of working in a multicultural global environment.\nMission\n1. Educating the students who are
column17: would be ""leaders of tomorrow"" in academia
column18: government
column19: industry and entrepreneurial pursuit
column20: through learner-centric teaching methodology of theory and practical’s and develop the ability to solve problems related to Civil Engineering
column21: individually and in teams.\n2. To develop knowledge of fundamental principles and innovative technologies through research within core areas of Civil Engineering and in collaboration with other disciplines that is distinguished by its impact on academic
column22: industry and society.\n3. To create in students deep awareness of ethical responsibilities to face the professional and from local
column23: national and international level challenges.\n### PEOs
column24:
POs and PSOs
### 
**PEO 1.** Apply the knowledge of science and technology to achieve sustainability in civil engineering construction.
**PEO 2.** Able to professionally plan
column25: analysis
column26:
design and execute civil engineering works.
**PEO 3.** Able to demonstrate the management skills as leaders/members of the team with ethical and societal responsibilities in engineering assignments
### 
Engineering Graduates will be able to
**PO 1.** Engineering Knowledge: – Apply the knowledge of mathematics science
column27: engineering fundamentals
column28: and an engineering specialization to a solution of complex engineering problems.\n**PO 2.** Problem analysis:- Identify
column30: review research literature
column31: and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusion using first principles of mathematics
column32: natural sciences
column33: and engineering sciences.\n**PO 3.** Design / Development of solutions:- Design solutions for complex engineering problems and design systems components or processes that meet specified needs with appropriate consideration for the public health and safety
column34: and the cultural
column35: societal and environmental considerations.\n**PO 4.** Conduct investigation of complex problems:- use research-based knowledge and research methods including design of experiments
column36: analysis
column37: and interpretation of data and synthesis of the information to provide valid conclusions.\n**PO 5.** Modern tool usage:- create select and apply appropriate techniques
column38: resources
column39: and modern engineering and IT tools including prediction and modeling to complex engineering activities with an understanding of the limitations.\n**PO 6.** The Engineer and Society:- apply reasoning informed by the contextual knowledge to assossocietal
column40: health
column43: and cultural issue and consequent responsibilities relevant to the professional engineering practice.\n**PO 7.** Environment and sustainability:- understand the impact of the professional engineering solution in societal and environmental contents
column44:
and demonstrate the knowledge of and need for sustainable development.
**PO 8.** Ethics:- apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms of the engineering practice.
**PO 9.** Individual and team works:- factions effectively as an individual and as a member or leader in diverse teams and multidisciplinary settings.
**PO 10.** Communications:- communicate effectively on complex engineering activities with the engineering community and with society at large such as being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation
column45: make effective presentations and give and receive if clear instructions.\n**PO 11.** Project management and finance:- demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering and management principles and apply these to one’s own work
column46: a member and leader in a team
column47: to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments.\n**PO 12.** Lifelong learning:- recognize the need for
column48: and have the preparation and ability to engage in the dependant and lifelong learning in the broadest context of technological changes.\n### \n**PSO 1.** Impart practical knowledge in civil engineering construction planning
column49: analysis
column50:
design and management.
**PSO 2.** Become a competent professional engineering to contribute towards the betterment of the society.
**PSO 3.** Become capable to function as an individual or in a team to find the solution for civil engineering of multidisciplinary nature in context to the environmental and sustainable developments.
### HOD
Department of Civil Engineering is headed by Prof.Rakesh Srivastava. He graduated in Civil Engineering with honours from HBTI
column51: Kanpur. He secured his M.E. degree with honours from MNNIT
column52: Allahabad and Ph.D. in Civil Engineering with specialization in Structures from MNNIT
column53: Allahabad.\nApart from rich experience in teaching and research
column54: he has also worked as a consultant in the field of Structural Engineering.\nHe has worked at different positions in AICTE approved Engineering Colleges as Dean of Student Welfare
column55: Dean Engineering
column56: and Controller of Examinations.\nHe has many publications in International Journals/Symposium/Conferences. He has attended and conducted many FDPs
column57:
National Seminars and International conference funded by AKTU and other agencies.
He is a fellow member of Institution of Engineers (India).
Dr. Rakesh Srivastava
B. Tech. Civil Engg. (Hons.) (HBTI)
column58: M.E. (Hons.) (MNNIT)
column59: Ph.D. (MNNIT) 9599670207 hodce@akgec.ac.in srivastavar@akgec.ac.in\n### CE Faculty\nFaculty at AKGEC fulfil multiple roles as educators

scholarly interests and areas of expertise thereby bringing substantial achievement in professional practice and research into the classroom.

### Labs
### 
1. The department has the adequate number of laboratories as per requirement (strength of students in the department and number of labs / practical courses mentioned in syllabus scheme of the university (AKTU

Lucknow).

"# Computer Science and Engineering
[ Faculty ](https://www.akgec.ac.in/cse-faculty/)
[ Labs ](https://www.akgec.ac.in/cse-labs/)
[ Achievements ](https://www.akgec.ac.in/cse-achievements/)
[ Society ](https://www.akgec.ac.in/life-akgec/societies/departmental-societies/conatus/)
[ Departmental Activities ](https://www.akgec.ac.in/cse-departmental-activities/)
[ CSE Journals ](https://www.akgec.ac.in/cse-journal-gjcs/)
**B. Tech. Computer Science and Engineering 180****B. Tech. Computer Science 150****B. Tech. Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning) 120****B. Tech. Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science) 120****B. Tech. Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning 60****B. Tech. Computer Science and Engineering (Hindi) 60****M. Tech. Computer Science and Engineering 18**
Department of Computer Science and Engineering at AKGEC was formed in 1998 with inception of the college. The Department provides an outstanding research environment complemented by excellence in teaching. Ever since its inception
column3: the department has been a pioneering academic centre for higher education
column5: and innovation in key areas of Computer Science. The department provides full support to MTech. scholars in terms dissertation guidance
column6:
lab facilities and access to international and national journals.
Experienced and senior faculty members are assigned for MTech courses and dissertation work of the scholars. The faculty members and M Tech scholars have published good quality research papers in peer-reviewed and indexed journals and International Conferences in the previous years.
### 
Vision
To be a centre of excellence in providing globally standard education and training in the field of Computer Science & Engineering for producing competent and responsible professionals.
Mission
To prepare students for successful careers and lifelong learning in Computer Science & Engineering while inculcating professional behavior
column7: strong ethical values and leadership abilities in them.\n### PEOs
column8: POs and PSOs\n### \n**PEO 1.** The graduates of CSE will have a strong foundation in mathematical
column9: scientific and engineering fundamentals necessary to formulate
column10: solve and analyze engineering problem in their career.\n**PEO 2.** The graduates of CSE will have the ability to analyse the requirements
column11:
understand the technical specifications and design the engineering solutions by applying computer science theory and principles.
**PEO 3.** The graduates of CSE will have exposure to work as teams on emerging cutting edge technologies with effective communication skills and leadership qualities.
**PEO 4.** The graduates of CSE will have successful career by engaging in life long learning.
**PEO 5.** The graduates of CSE will have skills to work collaboratively on multidisciplinary projects and exhibit high level of professional and ethical values.
### 
Engineering Graduates will be able to:
**PO 1.****Engineering knowledge :-** Apply the knowledge of mathematics
column14: and an engineering specialization to the solution of complex Computer Science & Engineering problems.\n**PO 2.****Problem analysis :-** Identify
column15: formulate
column16: review research literature
column17: and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions using first principles of mathematics
column18: natural sciences
column19: and engineering sciences.\n**PO 3.****Design/development of solutions :-** Design solutions for complex Computer Science & Engineering problems and design system components or processes that meet the specified needs with appropriate consideration for the public health and safety
column20: and the cultural
column21: societal
column22: and environmental considerations.\n**PO 4.****Conduct investigations of complex problems :-** Use research-based knowledge and research methods including design of experiments
column23: analysis and interpretation of data
column24: and synthesis of the information to provide valid conclusions.\n**PO 5.****Modern tool usage :-** Create
column25: select
column27: resources
column28: and modern engineering and IT tools including prediction and modeling to complex Computer Science & engineering activities with an understanding of the limitations.\n**PO 6.****The engineer and society :-** Apply reasoning informed by the contextual knowledge to assess societal
column30: safety
column31: legal and cultural issues and the consequent responsibilities relevant to the professional engineering practice.\n**PO 7.****Environment and sustainability :-** Understand the impact of the professional engineering solutions in societal and environmental contexts
column32: and demonstrate the knowledge of
column33: and need for sustainable development.\n**PO 8.****Ethics :-** Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms of the engineering practice.\n**PO 9.****Individual and team work :-** Function effectively as an individual
column34: and as a member or leader in diverse teams
column35: and in multidisciplinary settings.\n**PO 10.****Communication :-** Communicate effectively on complex Computer Science & engineering activities with the engineering community and with society at large
column36: such as
column37: being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation
column38: make effective presentations
column39: and give and receive clear instructions.\n**PO 11.****Project management and finance :-** Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering and management principles and apply these to one’s own work
column40: as a member and leader in a team
column41: to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments.\n**PO 12.****Life-long learning :-** Recognize the need for
column42: and have the preparation and ability to engage in independent and life-long learning in the broadest context of technological changes in the field of Computer Science.\n### \n**PSO 1.** Ability to exhibit analytical & logical skills and apply knowledge of Maths and Computer Science to design
column43: develop
column44: test and maintenance of software solutions.\n**PSO 2.** Ability to identify
column45: formulate and resolve real life/social problems by using current computer technology.\n### HOD\nDr. Anu Chaudhary
column46: is a Professor and Head at the Department of Computer Science and Engineering. He has an extensive background in both academia and industry
column47: with over 22 years of experience. He holds a Ph.D. in Computer Science from Gurukul Kangari University
column48: Hardwar (U.K) India
column49: specializing in the field of “Performance Evaluation of High Speed Data Networks."" He also has an M. Tech in Computer Science from Birla Institute of Technology (BIT)
column50: Mesra Ranchi
column51: and an MCA from the University of Madras. Dr. Chaudhary has made notable contributions to research
column52: having published more than 20 research papers in both international and national journals and conferences. He holds 6 patents at the national level. His academic engagement includes guiding Ph.D. scholars
column53: as well as supervising numerous M.Tech
column54: MCA
column55: and B.Tech projects. Dr. Chaudhary current area of research is in the field of High Speed Data Networks
column56: Machine Learning
column57: Data Science and related domains.\nHe's an active participant in the academic community
column58: serving on editorial and reviewer boards of various national and international journals. He has also taken on leadership roles by chairing multiple national and international conferences. Dr. Chaudhary is a member of several technical societies
column59: including the Institution of Electronics and Telecommunication Engineers (IETE) and the Computer Society of India (CSI).\nProf (Dr.) Anu Chaudhary\nPh.D (Computer Science)
column60: M.Tech (Computer Science)

column64: dr.anuchaudhary@gmail.com\n### CSE Faculty\nFaculty at AKGEC fulfil multiple roles as educators
column65: researchers and professionals having a broad range of backgrounds
column66:
scholarly interests and areas of expertise thereby bringing substantial achievement in professional practice and research into the classroom.

"# Electrical and Electronics Engineering
[ Faculty ](https://www.akgec.ac.in/en-faculty/)
[ Labs ](https://www.akgec.ac.in/en-labs/)
[ Achievements ](https://www.akgec.ac.in/en-achievements/)
[ Society ](https://www.akgec.ac.in/life-akgec/societies/departmental-societies/oorja/)
[ Departmental Activities ](https://www.akgec.ac.in/en-departmental-activities/)
**B. Tech. Electrical and Electronics Engineering 120****M. Tech. Electrical and Electronics Engineering 18**
Electrical Engineering stream involve the study and applications of Electricity
column3: Electronics and Electromagnetics that entails and encompasses Power Engineering
column5: Signal Processing
column6: Digital Computers and Instrumentation. The department is running undergraduate course in Electrical & Electronics Engineering since 2003 with a current intake of 120. Prior to this the course was Electrical Engineering since the inception of the college in 1998. The department is also running Post Graduate course on Electrical Power and Energy System since 2009 with the intake of 18.Now this PG course is renewed as Electrical & Electronics Engineering in 2016.\nThese areas of Electrical Engineering help student to enhance his or her capability to think critically & rationally
column7: employability and his or her utility for industry society and nation in large. Department is well equipped with state of art labs to train electrical graduates to advance their theoretical knowledge and sound practices of the profession. The students are encouraged to undertake projects in the areas of Machine Design
column8: Power System Planning
column9: Operations and Control
column10:
Electronics and Microprocessor Applications and Power Electronics.
### 
#### Vision
To produce excellent engineering professionals committed to serve the society & nature embedded with a strong moral character
column11:
value system and good leadership qualities having an urge for lifelong learning.
#### Mission
  * To empower the faculty members and encourage them to continually develop to keep pace with the changing trends in technology.
  * To provide a conducive environment for effective teaching and learning with focus on creating new knowledge
column12:
skills set and imbibing moral values with professional ethics.
  * To promote the culture of research and development through effective student engagement and regular infrastructural development.
  * To develop strong industry-academia alliance for practicing real time projects and also involve industry in content delivery.
  * To adopt transparent practices for the overall progress and welfare of the student
column14: POs and PSOs\n### \n**PEO 1.** Graduates of the program will apply skills and knowledge of Electrical and Electronics Engineering along with basic sciences

"# Electronics and Communication Engineering
[ Faculty ](https://www.akgec.ac.in/ece-regular-faculty/)
[ Labs ](https://www.akgec.ac.in/ece-labs/)
[ Achievements ](https://www.akgec.ac.in/ece-achievements/)
[ Society ](https://www.akgec.ac.in/life-akgec/societies/departmental-societies/phoenix/)
[ Departmental Activities ](https://www.akgec.ac.in/ece-department-activities/)
**B. Tech. Electronics and Communication Engineering 180****M. Tech. Electronics and Communication Engineering 18**
The Electronics and Communication stream represents two fastest growing technology areas in view of exponential growth taking place in our country. Electronics and Communication Engineering (ECE) involves researching
column4: developing and testing of electronic equipment used in various systems. Electronics and Communication Engineering is also considered as the backbone of the modern communication system. In the current scenario
column5: modern applications like the Internet of Things (IoT)
column6: Robotics
column7: and Embedded Systems are highly dependent on the knowledge of ECE. Electronics and Communications engineers also conceptualize and oversee the manufacturing of communications and broadcast systems. It has an important role from defence sector to space programs to the basic need of human beings including the internet to the entertainment industry. Electronics and Communication Engineering has a wide scope as compared to other.\nThere are numerous opportunities to build a career after completing the engineering course in the field of Electronics and Communication Engineering. An individual can make his/her career in IT industry
column8: defence
column9: telecommunications
column10: electronic and hardware manufacturing
column11: embedded systems development
column14: TV and music industry
column15: automobiles
column16: space communications
column17: home appliances development
column18: electronic security systems
column19: mobile phones testing and development
column20: communication protocols development and optical communications development among others.\nDepartment of Electronics and Communication Engineering at AKGEC was established in 1998. The department provides an outstanding research environment complemented by excellence in teaching. Ever since its inception
column21: the department has been a pioneering academic centre for technical education
column22: research and innovation in all major areas of Electronics and Communication Engineering.\nThe department is organized in tune with these latest developments in terms of curriculum
column23: well-qualified faculty and the state-of-the-art labs for B.Tech. (UG course) in Electronics & Communication Engineering along with M.Tech. (PG course) in Electronics & Communication Engineering. Approved intake of B.Tech. (ECE) course is 180 students and for the M.Tech. (ECE) course it is 18 students.\nThe department has adequate number of laboratories as per requirement (strength of students in the department and number of practical courses mentioned in syllabus scheme). These laboratories are fully equipped with latest / modern hardware kits / equipments
column24: software tools and consumables. ECE labs have all the basic as well as advanced level facilities to fulfill the requirements of UG
column25: PG and PhD level courses. These laboratories are fully utilized by the students and faculty members of ECE department for performing the practical experiments
column26: doing the Project Work and Research Activities (R & D). One dedicated Lab Staff member is always present in each laboratory room. Responsibility of each lab room also has been assigned to a Faculty Lab Incharge to ensure regular maintenance and up-gradation of laboratories. ECE department also has established Texas Instruments-Centre of Excellence Lab
column27: NI-LabVIEW Academy
column28: Virtual Lab (with IIT Kanpur) and IoT Lab etc in collaboration with reputed industries and academic institutes.\nThe department has its technical society-Phoenix. The society organizes many technical competitions
column30: technical seminars
column31: mock interviews
column32: aptitude tests
column33: project exhibition and technical paper presentation etc for the students. ECE department also has an active IEEE-Communication Society student branch chapter for organizing / participating various events at international level.\n**B. Tech. ECE is accredited by National Board of Accreditation (NBA).**\nINITIAL ACCREDITATION-2006

FOURTH RE-ACCREDITATION-2022
### 
#### Vision
To supplement intellect with the right skills & knowledge so as to nurture Electronics & Communication experts of tomorrow.
#### Mission
**M1:** To ensure that students acquire and sustain the right theoretical and practical electronics and communication engineering knowledge.**M2:** To keep the students updated with the current Electronics and Communication Engineering developments.**M3:** To assist the students to become global engineers to meet the relevant and timely needs of the society.
### PEOs
column38:
POs and PSOs
### 
**PEO 1.** Engineering Graduates will excel in Electronics & Communication fields both in the industry and academics by analyzing the requirement technically and applying their knowledge in a professional manner.
**PEO 2.** Will enable Engineering graduates effectively solve engineering problems and develop through research advanced Electronics & Communication devices and products.
**PEO 3.** Engineering graduates will be capable of applying their knowledge both individually and as part of a team. They will be able to effectively communicate the same through the required media.
**PEO 4.** Graduates will be capable of realizing the untoward and hazardous impacts of their contributions/innovations and keep ethical and societal values and responsibilities before individual achievements.
**PEO 5.** Keep pace with the ongoing improvements and advancements in the field of Electronics & Communication and not only incorporate but carry forward the same.
### 
Engineering Graduates will be able to:
**PO 1.****Engineering knowledge :-** Apply the knowledge of mathematics

column40: engineering fundamentals
column41: and an engineering specialization to the solution of complex Electronics and Communication Engineering problems.\n**PO 2.****Problem analysis :-** Identify

column44: and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions using first principles of mathematics
column45: natural sciences
column46: and engineering sciences.\n**PO 3.****Design/development of solutions :-** Design solutions for complex Electronics and Communication Engineering problems and design system components or processes that meet the specified needs with appropriate consideration for the public health and safety
column47: and the cultural
column48: societal
column49: and environmental considerations.\n**PO 4.****Conduct investigations of complex problems :-** Use research-based knowledge and research methods including design of experiments
column50: analysis and interpretation of data
column51: and synthesis of the information to provide valid conclusions.\n**PO 5.****Modern tool usage :-** Create
column52: select
column53: and apply appropriate techniques
column54: resources
column55: and modern engineering and IT tools including prediction and modeling to complex engineering activities with an understanding of the limitations.\n**PO 6.****The engineer and society :-** Apply reasoning informed by the contextual knowledge to assess societal
column56: health

column59: and demonstrate the knowledge of
column60: and need for sustainable development.\n**PO 8.****Ethics :-** Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms of the engineering practice.\n**PO 9.****Individual and team work :-** Function effectively as an individual
column61: and as a member or leader in diverse teams
column62: and in multidisciplinary settings.\n**PO 10.****Communication :-** Communicate effectively on complex engineering activities with the engineering community and with society at large
column63: such as
column64: being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation
column65: make effective presentations
column66: and give and receive clear instructions.\n**PO 11.****Project management and finance :-** Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering and management principles and apply these to one’s own work
column67: as a member and leader in a team
column68: to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments.\n**PO 12.****Life-long learning :-** Recognize the need for
column69:
and have the preparation and ability to engage in independent and life-long learning in the broadest context of technological changes in the field of Electronics and Communication.
### 
**PSO 1.** Graduates of the program will be able to analyze real world engineering problems in the field of Electronics and Communication engineering.
**PSO 2.** Graduates of the program will be able to design and develop systems/processes based on core concepts of Electronics and Communication engineering to provide solution to multidisciplinary engineering problems.

### HOD
Prof. (Dr.) Neelesh Kumar Gupta is a seasoned professional with an illustrious career spanning over 22 years of teaching in reputed technical institutes. He obtained Ph.D in Electronics and Communication Engineering from Rajiv Gandhi Technical University (RGTU)
column70: Bhopal (M.P.). Presently
column71: Dr. Neelesh Kumar Gupta is working as Professor & HoD in Electronics and Communication Engineering Department & IQAC Coordinator at Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College
column72: Ghaziabad (U.P.)-India. Earlier he served in TRUBA Institute of Engineering and Information Technology
column73: Bhopal as Prof. & HoD ECE. He completed his Graduation (B.E.) in Electronics and Communication Engineering from Rajiv Gandhi Prodhyogiki Vishwavidyalaya (RGPV)
column74: Bhopal (M.P.) in 2002 and his Post-Graduation (M. Tech) from the prestigious Maulana Azad National Institute of Technology (MANIT)
column75: Bhopal (M.P.) in 2007 with specialization in “Microwave and Millimeter Waves”.\nHis area of expertise/special interest includes Signal Processing
column76: Communication Systems and Microwave Engineering. Prof. (Dr.) Neelesh Kumar Gupta has published 04 Patents (IPRs) in total including 02 Design Patents. He has published more than 35 research papers in SCI
column78: UGC approved
column79: Peer Reviewed / reputed journals. He also has over 61 publications in reputed International/ National Conference proceedings published by IEEE Explore and Springer etc. He has successfully guided 35 M. Tech scholars for Thesis / Dissertations as well guided many UG students for Projects. He also co-authored a book titled as “Fundamentals of Electronics Engineering” for Tech-Max Publications
column80: Pune.\nProf. (Dr.) Neelesh Kumar Gupta is an active member of several professional bodies/societies including IEEE
column81: IETE New Delhi etc. He is the reviewer and editorial member of several International Journals of repute and also chaired Technical Sessions in many International Conferences. He has organized many Conferences
column82: FDPs
column83: Technical Seminars and Workshops at the institute level. His Video Lectures have been broadcasted on Swayam Prabha Channel-15 and AKTU Digital Education Portal. He was honoured with reputed “Guru Faculty Award”
column84: with Best Teacher Award in Srijan-2015 and was also awarded by IETE on the occasion of Teachers Day.\nProf. (Dr.) Neelesh Kumar Gupta\nPh.D (ECE)

"# Information Technology
[ Faculty ](https://www.akgec.ac.in/it-faculty/)

**B. Tech. Information Technology 180** **B. Tech. Computer Science and Information Technology 120**
IT has changed the way of our life and the pace of change is very fast. This scenario is giving us new opportunity as well as new challenges. IT has enhanced the efficiency and effectiveness of business processes dramatically. ERP solutions have further empowered the organizations to do multi-location
column3: multilingual and multicurrency operation in the global business environment. New ways of marketing
column5: communication and socialization have come up in the form of blogs
column6: forums
column8: emails etc.\nIT is working as a hub to drive the businesses to new heights. IT jobs are more paying as well as more demanding. To continuously learn and grasp new technologies is a real challenge for IT professionals. Creating such professionals to take this challenge and rise to the apex of IT profession is our goal. At AKGEC excellence is the way of life. We are committed to give students an environment to nurture their talent in to its fullest potential. This is achieved by learned faculty members
column9: year round conduction of numerous seminars
column10: guest lectures
column11: and industry academia interaction
column12:
co-curricular & extracurricular activities. We strive to transform the students not only into good professionals but a good human being and a dutiful citizen.
### 
Vision
The vision of IT department is to produce highly competent and socially sensitive IT professionals and innovators
column13: capable to excel in the multicultural and challenging industry scenario.\nMission\nTo establish a truly professional academic environment where sound and transparent teaching-learning processes are practiced by all stakeholders of the organization that helps in producing all around competent
column14: humane and socially responsible industry-ready engineers who are capable of taking challenges from ever-demanding multi-cultural industrial environment.\n### PEOs
column15:
POs and PSOs
### 
**PEO 1.** Graduate Engineers will have high level of technical competence and necessary skills to achieve great success in Information Technology and related area.
**PEO 2.** Graduate Engineers will have required research & problem solving skills to generate innovative solution.
**PEO 3.** Graduate Engineers will have team spirits
column16: communication and inter-personal skill to effectively work with all stakeholders in their professional career.\n**PEO 4.** Graduate Engineer will have right kind of mindset and attitude with regard to societal needs and ethical responsibilities and quickly adept to global work environment.\n**PEO 5.** Graduate Engineers shall be able to continuously advance their educational growth and learn new technological know-how

relevant to their career enhancement and betterment of society.
###

**PO 1.** **Engineering knowledge :-** Apply the knowledge of mathematics

Graduate of the program will be able to:
**PSO 1.** Apply the acquired technical skills to enhance IT support and automation in various fields and applications in the latest trends and technologies.
**PSO 2.** Understand
column49: analyze and develop IT based practical solutions for real world problems using appropriate methodology and to support sustainable development.\n### HOD\nDr. Rahul Sharma stands as a distinguished computer scientist
column50: seamlessly embodying the roles of a professor and an inventive educator-entrepreneur. His professional journey is a testament to his unwavering dedication to knowledge exploration and a fervent commitment to advancing the frontiers of research and education.\nCurrently
column51: he is heading the Information Technology Department and Technical Business Incubator at Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College
column52: Ghaziabad. Simultaneously

column54: Estonia and also engaged with prestigious research institutions in Finland and Germany. These collaborations underscore his position as a key player in the international arena
column55: contributing to the forefront of cutting-edge advancements in computer science.\nIn the dynamic intersection of academia and entrepreneurship
column56: Dr. Sharma's leadership fosters an environment that nurtures innovation and practical application. His multifaceted approach to education and research positions him as a thought leader
column57: inspiring those around him to push boundaries and contribute meaningfully to the evolving landscape of technology.\nProf. (Dr.) Rahul Sharma\nB.Tech

"# Mechanical Engineering
[ Faculty ](https://www.akgec.ac.in/me-faculty/)

**B. Tech. Mechanical Engineering 60****M. Tech. Mechanical Engineering 18**
Department of Mechanical Engineering at AKGEC was formed in 1998 with inception of the college. The Department provides an outstanding research environment complemented by excellence in teaching. Ever since its inception
column3: the department has been a pioneering academic centre for higher education
column5: and innovation in key areas of Mechanical Engineering. The department provides full support to MTech. scholars in terms dissertation guidance
column6:
lab facilities and access to international and national journals. Experienced and senior faculty members are assigned for MTech courses and dissertation work of the scholars. The faculty members and M Tech scholars have published good quality research papers in peer-reviewed and indexed journals and International Conferences.
### 
#### Vision
To produce professionally competent
column8: motivated
column9:
honest and dedicated mechanical engineers capable of working in multicultural global environment.
#### Mission
**M1:** Assist students in acquiring and maintaining the necessary theoretical and practical Mechanical Engineering knowledge.**M2:** To keep students up to date on the latest innovations in Mechanical Engineering.**M3:** Assisting students in becoming global engineers to address society's relevant and timely needs.
### PEOs
column10: POs and PSOs\n### \n**PEO 1.** The graduates of the mechanical engineering progamme will have adequate knowledge of science
column11: mathematics and management field to suitably use it in practical problem studies and analysis to arrive at right solutions/decisions.\n**PEO 2.** The graduate of the mechanical engineering programme will have sound and in-depth knowledge and skill of core mechanical fields viz. Machine Design
column14: CAD/CAM
column15: hydraulics and mechanics
column16:
Strength of Materials and Materials Science in particular and other associated fields of mechanical engineering in general. The graduates of mechanical engineering programme will have successful professional careers.
**PEO 3.** The graduates of mechanical engineering programme will acquire additional advanced and updated knowledge through modified curriculum by making use of technological facilities available in centre of excellence (Tifac-core) of the institute.
**PEO 4.** To promote institute and industry relations through regular interactions and by creating memorandum of understanding between the two. The graduates of mechanical engineering will be capable of demonstrating their management skills as leaders/members of a team in engineering assignments.
**PEO 5.** The graduates of mechanical engineering programme will continue to learn and to adapt in a world of constantly evolving technology. The graduate of mechanical engineering programme will be capable of continuing further higher studies at National and international level.

column42: being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation
column43: make effective presentations
column44: and give and receive clear instructions.\n**PO 11.****Project management and finance :-** Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering and management principles and apply these to one’s own work
column45: as a member and leader in a team
column46: to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments.\n**PO 12.****Life-long learning :-** Recognize the need for
column47: and have the preparation and ability to engage in independent and life-long learning in the broadest context of technological change.\n### \n**PSO 1.****Research Skills :-** Use research based knowledge to conduct investigations
column48: analysis and interpretation of the information from relevant literature to arrive at valid conclusions.\n**PSO 2.****Analytical Skills :-** Identify
column49: formulate and analyze complex engineering problems related to mechanical engineering domain.\n**PSO 3.****Problem-Solving Skills :-** Apply knowledge of mathematics and science to solve engineering problems in the broad area of thermal
column50: design and production and simultaneously develop problem solving skills.\n### HOD\n**Dr. Pallab Biswas** is the Professor and Head of the Department of Mechanical Engineering. He completed his B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering from North Eastern Regional Institute of Science and Technology in 1998. He served in the Mechanical and IT industry for approximately 4 years and then started his teaching career as Faculty in Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College in January 2002. He completed his M.Tech in Automation and Robotics in 2009. He was awarded Ph.D in Supply Chain Management from Department of Mechanical Engineering
column51: Indian Institute of Technology Delhi in 2018. His area of expertise includes Industrial Engineering
column52: Production Engineering and Management Sciences. He is reviewer of Journal of Advances in Management Research (JAMR)
column53: Supply Chain Management: an International Journal (SCMIJ)
column54: International Journal of Business Forecasting and Marketing Intelligence (IJBFMI). He was awarded by the Vice Chancellor – AKTU for having excelled in teaching subjects that includes Industrial Engineering and Manufacturing Science. He is the Faculty Advisor of the Music Club of the College – EUPHONY and the Mechanical Engineering Student Society – SAMVEG. He supervised 3 M. Tech Theses and more than 28 B.Tech projects in last 20 years of teaching career. He was actively involved in the NBA and NAAC visits in the department level during last decade. His prime focus will be on the academic research and innovation amongst faculty and students of Mechanical Engineering.\nDr. Pallab Biswas\nProfessor and Head B.Tech
column55: M.Tech
column56: Ph.D. (IIT

column58: researchers and professionals having a broad range of backgrounds

scholarly interests and areas of expertise thereby bringing substantial achievement in professional practice and research into the classroom.

content_chunk: "# Fee Refund Norms\nIn case of cancellation of admission
column3:
fee will be refunded as per the AICTE notification and G.O. passed by the U.P. Government.
**S.No** |  **REQUEST FOR REFUND** |  **REFUND**  
---|---|---  
a. |  Request received before start of session |  Entire fee after deduction of Rs.1000/-  
b. |  Request received after start of session and seat not beingfilled by the College till the last date of admissions |  Caution money only  
In case of withdrawal from hostel
column4: only security and mess charges (for unutilized months) are refundable on a pro rata basis.\n  * 27th Km Milestone

content_chunk: "# Alumni Meet\n### \nThe 18th Alumni Meet 2025
column3: organized by the Alumni Association of Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College on 5th April 2025 at the College Football Ground
column4: was a heartwarming event filled with nostalgia
column5: camaraderie
column6: and joyful reunions. The gracious presence of Dr. R. K. Agarwal
column8: added immense inspiration
column9: as alumni expressed their gratitude for his unwavering support and guidance. Alumni from the 2003 and 2004 batches
column10: as well as from AKGIM and AKGEC
column11: participated enthusiastically
column12: especially during the engaging open mic session. Fun-filled activities like Tambola and Musical Chairs brought an element of playfulness
column13: while vibrant dance performances by Taal
column14: soulful songs by Euphony
column15: and a dazzling fashion show by Verve added to the festive atmosphere. The evening concluded with energetic dancing at the DJ night. Dr. Rahul Sharma
column16: Head of the Department of IT and Dean
column17: Idea Lab
column18: extended heartfelt thanks to all attendees for their enthusiastic participation and continued support. The event was further graced by the presence of Heads of Departments
column19: Deans
column20: Section In-charges
column21: and faculty members
column22: who reconnected with alumni and shared cherished memories
column23: contributing to the event’s grand success.\n### \nAKGEC has always recognized the significance of its alumni network
column24: considering it as a valuable asset. Established in 2005
column25: the AKGEC Alumni Association has consistently worked towards fostering enduring relationships with its alumni

content_chunk:
"# Anti-Ragging Measures & Induction Program
### 
ANTI RAGGING MEASURES
Like every year this year
column3: too Anti-Ragging Campaign began with a meeting of the Director General with All HODs and the launching of an air balloon with Anti Ragging Message above the college complex.\nKIRAN: Anti Ragging awareness among senior students began with KIRAN (Kaho India Ragging Aur Nahin) program. The proctor of the college addressed all 2nd
column4: 3rd & 4th year students on 6 & 7 October 2022 mentioning the ills of the ragging and provision of strict punishment to be awarded if one is involved in any incidence of ragging. Various provisions of ragging as laid down by UGC/AICTE were explained. Video clips available on the UGC site were also shown to all students. Students were also educated on the ills of drugs.\nINDUCTION PROGRAM: 2022-23\nAs per guidelines laid down by AICTE/University
column5:
a three-week induction program was planned for all firstyear students wef 7 Nov 2022 to 27 Nov 2022. The following daily activities were performed as per a wellplanned time schedule. The report of Induction Program as desired by the university has already been submitted through given Google Form link: https://tinyurl.com/28a8usv4 mentioned in letter No: AKTU/Dean UG/2022/644 Dated: 01/12/2022. A copy of the same report duly signed by the Induction Program Coordinator and the Director of the college is enclosed.
1. Daily PT/YOGA: PT was carried out in small size squads of 30 students residing in the college hostel. Each of the squad was supervised by a senior student under the overall supervision of a well-trained PT teacher. The activity was conducted daily from 06:30 am to 07:00 am during Induction Period.
2. Human Value Classes: Each section of first year students of class size of 60 was taught Human Value aspects by selected faculty mentors qualified in Human Value and Professional Ethics Course conducted by the university. List of mentors provided in the Induction report form enclosed.
3. Creative Art Sessions: First-year students were segregated depending on their choices of activities and were allotted to their respective activity groups for sufficient numbers of periods for conducting Creative Art Sessions.
4. Literary and Proficiency: First year students were subjected to literary activities such as reading
column6: writing
column7: debating activities in their respective counselor’s periods. They also discussed with students to make them familiar with English
column8: common applications of Computer such as PowerPoint
column9:
MS Word and MS Excel sheet etc.
5. Lectures by Eminent People: Multiple sessions of guest lectures were planned and conducted by eminent people on subjects of importance to make them handle any adverse situation. Each student was addressed in groups by the following speakers on the topic shown below: –
#### Shri Sushil Agarwal: Motivation and Character Development on 10 Nov 2022
#### Shri Amar Chaudhary: Motivation on 11 Nov 2022
#### Brig. Ramesh Chandra: Time & Stress Management on 14 Nov 2022
#### Col T. P. Tyagi: Nationalism on 17 Nov 2022
6. Visit of local Areas: All students were made to visit the college Faith Centre and various departments. They were also given a virtual tour of the college facilities and other departments by senior students of societies.
7. Engineering Exploration Program: All students in groups were addressed by the General Manager of AKG Skill Centre/TIFAC CORE on various industrial collaborations / MOU existing in the college. These were conducted across all 10 skill centers such as LabVIEW Academy
column10: Industrial Robotics Training Centre
column11: BOSCH Rexroth Centre
column14: AIA Competence Development Centre
column15:
FRONIUS Advance Welding Technology & Research Centre.
8. Evening Games: All first-yearstudents were made to attend games period from 4-5 PM daily and were to play/watch at least one game of their choice under an assigned coach hired by the college.
9. Anti-Ragging Kite Flying:
10. Feedback Obtained: All students were asked to provide feedback on the conduct and quality of the induction program. Most of the students provided Excellent grading for Induction Program activities. A few comments made by most of the students were as “It was amazing and very informative”

Fresher Party: A fresher party for first-year students by second-year students of the college is being held on 9 Dec 2022 beginning at 05:30 pm. Besides various cultural programs being put up by second-year students

content_chunk: "# Convocation\n### \nAjay Kumar Garg Engineering College (AKGEC)
column4: proudly celebrated its 20th Annual Convocation Ceremony on April 5
column6: in the esteemed presence of Prof. J.P. Pandey
column8: and Dr. Anil Sahasrabudhe
column9: Chairman of NETF
column10: NAAC (EC)
column11: and NBA
column12: who graced the occasion as Chief Guest. The event commenced at 11:00 AM with Dr. R.K. Agarwal
column14: presenting the annual report
column15: showcasing the college’s achievements in academics
column16: co-curricular activities
column17: and social outreach while emphasizing the institution’s focus on values and ethics.\nIn his keynote
column18: Dr. Sahasrabudhe highlighted the rapid advancements in AI
column19: Machine Learning
column20: ChatGPT
column21: and Robotics
column22: commended India's digital strength during the pandemic
column23: and encouraged students to embrace value-based education with a global mindset. Prof. J.P. Pandey inspired graduates to become job creators and future leaders
column24: acknowledging the contributions of teachers and parents. Degrees were awarded to 1235 students from B.Tech
column25: M.Tech
column27: with Shri Ashok Kumar Pal leading the Graduation Oath
column28: making the event a significant and memorable milestone.\n### \nAjay Kumar Garg Engineering College
column29: Ghaziabad conducted its 19th annual convocation ceremony with all the grandeur and magnificence on 30th March 2024. The ceremony commenced at 11:00 AM in the auspicious presence of Prof. J. P. Pandey Honourable Vice Chancellor AKTU and Chief Guest Dr. R.S. Sharma
column30: IAS (Retd.) Distinguished Visiting Professor
column31: IIT Kanpur
column32: Former Secretary
column33: Govt. of India
column34: Dr. R.K. Agarwal
column35: the Director General of the college presented college annual report highlighting the progress of the college and various academic
column36: cultural
column37: social and sports achievements of the students at college as well as university level. He brought out that our focus is to inculcate good moral values
column38: ethics
column39: work culture and positive attitude in all students
column40: faculty and staff.\nThis year 1146 students of B. Tech. and MCA from 2022-23 academic session were felicitated with their degrees on the accomplishment of their graduate and post-graduate courses. 15 students of the college figured in the AKTU Branch-wise merit list. Dr. R.S. Sharma

column50: Uttar Pradesh
column51: Lucknow addressed the students and advised the students to keep a sharp eye on their goals in their professional’s career ahead. The Chief Guest Dr. R.S. Sharma advised the students to move in the direction of their dreams with discipline and dedication.\n  * 27th Km Milestone

content_chunk: "# Farewell Party\n### \nThe farewell event प्रयाण ’25 for the outgoing B.Tech
column5: and MBA batches was held on 23rd May 2025 with heartfelt celebration. Organized by juniors
column6: the evening featured a warm welcome
column8: captivating performances by Euphony
column9: Taal
column10: MBA and MCA students
column11: along with fun games by Horizon. The event concluded with a Vote of Thanks and dinner
column12: leaving behind cherished memories and joyful goodbyes.\n### \n`Samvartan’
column13: the farewell ceremony for the final year students of B. Tech & MCA was successfully organized on 02 Jun 2024
column14: Friday in the College Sports Grounds under the ambiance of the good weather & night sky which added to the grandeur of the occasion.\nThe party was held after a gap of about 4 years due to the past covid situation with a new and better format of organizing party games.The evening commenced with the arrival of Director General
column15: Deans
column16: HODs
column17: Faculty Members and Section ICs. After a great start with a beautiful poem by Shrey Shukla
column18: the DG was presented with a sapling by DSW (Prof. V.K. Parashar). A scintillating musical program was presented by Euphony
column19: the musical society
column20: setting the right tone of the party.\nThereafter
column21:
the following party games were organized by the pre-final year students and faculty members from various departments enjoyed by a large number of final year students.• STATUE DANCE (EC+MCA Dept.)• BALLOON DANCE (CS Dept)• PASSING THE PARCEL (IT Dept)• MUSICAL CHAIR (ME/EN/CE Dept)
Winners & runners up of each party game was presented with handsome prizes.
A `guess the weight’ of a gift item was also played and participated by about 200 final year students. Arpit of B. Tech 4th year EN won the same gift item by guessing weight nearest to the actual weight.
A Vote of Thanks was than proposed towards all those who worked wholeheartedly towards making the evening a grand success.
The function was followed by a sumptuous dinner and a vibrant DJ night. End of the DJ & Dinner
column22: all the final year students were very happy and excited to receive a coffee mug with AKGEC logo printed as a token of remembrance from the pre-final year students.\n### \n**Sandishya –** perfect ending of a beautiful journey
column23: the Farewell Function for the B. Tech 4th Year batch (2015-19) was successfully organized by the 3rd year students on 8 June
column24: 2019.\nThe 3rd year students presented a scintillating cultural evening with performances by the Cultural societies – Taal
column25: Verve

content_chunk: "# Freshers Party\nThe Freshers' Party
column6: transformed the campus into a realm of magic and wonder
column8: M. Tech
column9: MCA
column10: and MBA students with an atmosphere of mystique and charm. The night was filled with captivating performances
column11: immersive activities
column12: and enchanting moments that created an unforgettable experience. The nature-inspired ambiance encouraged instant connections
column14: and boundless creativity. Blending AKGEC’s traditions with a vision of limitless possibilities
column15: every detail—from whimsical decor to lively entertainment—evoked a spirit of adventure and discovery. This celebration of new beginnings allowed dreams to flourish
column16: bonds to form
column17: and memories to be etched in the hearts of all
column18: marking a perfect start to an exciting academic journey and leaving everyone eager for what lies ahead.\n### \nAKGEC organized a highly successful Freshers' Party (“नवाध्याय '२३"") on December 8th
column19: bringing together B. Tech
column20: M. Tech
column21: MCA
column22: and MBA students. The meticulously planned event fostered warmth and camaraderie
column23: as the college community wholeheartedly welcomed the newest members. The festivities included spirited interactions
column24: engaging activities
column25: and a vibrant showcase of talent. AKGEC's commitment to creating a profound sense of belonging was evident in every detail
column26: leaving an indelible experience for incoming students. The triumphant execution of “नवाध्याय '२३"" set a positive tone for the academic year
column27: highlighting AKGEC's dedication to establishing a supportive and inclusive learning environment.\n### \nPulsating ambience
column28: flashing lights
column30: marked the dawn of SAHASRA' 2019 – The Freshers’ Party for AKGEC B.Tech
column31: AKGEC MCA and AKGIM MBA newly admitted students on 30 September
column32: 2019. The excitement inflated to a high as performances graced the stage. Joy and happiness could be seen on the faces all around.\nThe evening gave room to the newcomers to build a rapport with their batch mates
column33: seniors and faculty and become part of the AKGEC fraternity. Dr. R.K Agarwal
column34: Director General
column36: welcomed the young energy in the clan and inspired them to put in their best for a happy
column37:
successful and prosperous life ahead.
Mr. & Ms. Fresher | B.Tech | Kartikey Verma & Anushree Gupta  
---|---|---  
Mr. & Ms. Personality | B.Tech | Aditya Mishra & Parul Choudhary  
Blissful gestures
column38: flickering faces
column39: enthralled beats of dance floor and sumptuous dinner were the defining moments of the evening.\n### \nAjay Kumar Garg Engineering College always aims to provide students a comfortable surrounding and encourage them to excel and prosper in their life. With this theme
column40: the college commemorated the new beginning of first year students by building a friendly atmosphere for the freshmen and welcoming them for their exciting journey ahead with an evening of exuberance.\nFresher’s party is a gracious and a cordial welcome by the second year students to the first year students. It is an event where freshers are not only given a chance to exhibit their talents but also feel comfortable and adapt to the new surroundings. With this spirit
column41: AANAVYA 2018 was organized on 19-09-2018 to felicitate the first year students for the new journey ahead.\nThe event was graced by the presence of Director R.K. Agarwal and HoDs of various departments. A series of amazing performances were put up by the 2nd year students
column43: dramatics
column44: fashion show and singing performances.\nThe event wouldn’t have been a huge success without the valuable efforts of Prof. V.K. Parashar
column45: DSW who constantly aided the 2nd year students in organizing this grand fiesta. The Director addressed the first year with his esteemed words of wisdom and encouraged them to excel in all spheres of life.\n### \nThe wondrous fresher party
column46:
**Vihaan 2017** commenced as the anchors welcomed the respected faculty members and the newly admitted first year students. Director Dr. R.K. Agarwal was welcomed with a presentation of sapling.
This magnifying event started with a reminiscing Ganesh Vandana performed by the 2nd year Taal members as a token of almighty's blessing. Director Dr. R.K. Agarwal then took upon the stage as he addressed the freshman 2017. He welcomed and appreciated the first year on their new journey ahead and imparted important life lessons to the students.
The award ceremony followed next as the talented and meritorious students of the college were awarded with accolades by the Director Dr. R.K. Agarwal. This was followed by a talent hunt and a questionnaire round to choose the best from all the contestants.
The ceremony advanced with the ramp walk and talent hunt for Mr and Miss Fresher's 2017. The first year contestants elegancy and talents swayed us all. This was followed by a round of questionnaire. The participants stole the glam light and performed wonderfully.
Goonj
column47:
the dramatics society of our college then gave a very crucial message on religion and livelihood in their amazingly performed play themed MAZHAB. The ramp was then lighted up by the glamorous divas and hunks of Team Verve who stole away audiences heart by their spectacular performance. They showcased their modelling skills as they sent an important message of self acceptance. The stage was then lit up by Team Taal as they hyped the entire aura with a dance performance on latest Bollywood music.
**The most awaited event of the show followed as the following winners were awarded by Director Dr. R.K. Agarwal**
Mr. Fresher
Fahad Khan
Ms. Fresher
Nidhi Shukla
Mr. Personality
Vaibhav Lakhmani
Ms. Personality
Mansi Goyal
The night was then tuned into a melodious mood as the members of Team Euphony stole away all the hearts with their heart throbbing performance. It was indeed a marvellous medley. The evening concluded and came to end with the vote of thanks and appreciation of the convenors without whose efforts the event wouldn't have been successfully and thriving.
### 
**‘Udbhav’**
column48: the welcome party for the First Year students of B.Tech was organized by their immediate seniors on 8th September
column49: 2016. The evening marked the induction and integration of new entrants into the AKGEC family. The event created many memories for the first year students and their seniors alike
column50: with an array of cultural programs organized by the various cultural societies of AKGEC
column51: namely Sur
column52: Taal
column53: Goonj
column54: Footprints and the College band ‘Euphony’. The second year students synergized their efforts to put up a plethora of scintillating performances in the form of traditional
column55: fusion and western dances
column56: exhilarating singing performances and splendid decoration
column57: thus making Udbhav a soulful evening.\nUdbhav also saw a very enthusiastic participation from the First Year students of B.Tech who competed with full zeal and great enthusiasm to be crowned the Mr. and Ms. Fresher’16. After three rounds of exemplary performances comprising Ramp Walk
column58: Question & Answer Round and Individual Talent Round
column59: the following 1st Year students became the freshest faces of AKGEC
column60:
selected by an eminent jury and were awarded the titles as indicated below:-
Mr. Fresher
Rajat Shukla
Ms. Fresher
Chaitali Kataria
Mr. Personality
Harsh Trivedi
Ms. Personality
Vaishali Tomar
The results were announced by the Dean Students Welfare Prof. V.K. Parashar
column61: who was instrumental in the organization and smooth conduct of Udbhav’16. The titles were conferred by the honorable Director Dr. R.K. Agarwal
column62: who graced the occasion with his benign presence and imparted his words of wisdom to the First Year students and motivated them to aim for excellence.\nEvery event of AKGEC reflects the rich culture and legacy that the college strives to inculcate among its students
column63: and ‘Udbhav 2016' was no exception to this fact. The event exhorted the First Year students to imbibe this rich legacy and reflect it in achievements of excellence in all the spheres of their life. The Freshers Party 2016 concluded with the Student Conveners Rishab Maurya
column64: Shagun Singh and Anubhav extending the Vote of Thanks towards all those who were involved in making Udbhav the memorable evening it proved to be
column65: for the AKGEC family. The evening ended with a sumptuous dinner and the students left the venue with beautiful memories to cherish throughout their college life.\n  * 27th Km Milestone

"# Scrolls
### 
Team HORIZON Proudly Organized 14th edition of SCROLLS- Students’ Creative and Oratory Learning Skills.
SCROLLS
column3: an annual National-level Technical Paper Presentation Contest was organized by AKGEC in association with Ghaziabad Management Association (GMA) on 8th May
column4: 2024. SCROLLS embodies the spirit of innovation and academic excellence. Serving as a platform for budding minds to showcase their ingenuity and eloquence
column5: SCROLLS fosters creativity and fosters a passion for technical research and presentation.\nWith over 500 passionate participants from institutes all over India
column6: SCROLLS’24 received an overwhelming response. From these
column7: 95 exceptional team presentations were selected for the final round
column8: reflecting the commitment to excellence and innovation. In recognition of the outstanding contributions of participants
column9: SCROLLS 24 offered prizes exceeding Rs 1 lakh
column10: along with AKGEC Skills Foundation Coupons worth Rs 7000.\nBehind the seamless execution of SCROLLS 24 stands the dedicated efforts of the organizing team
column11: Team HORIZON
column12: the sole Techno-managerial society of the college
column13: whose meticulous planning and unwavering dedication have been instrumental in making this event a resounding success. The organizing team worked day and night to make this event a successful one.\nAs SCROLLS 24 unfolds
column14: it not only celebrates innovation and academic prowess but also serves as a beacon of inspiration for future generations of thinkers
column15: creators
column16: and leaders. Let us come together to celebrate innovation
column17: nurture talent
column18: and foster a culture of excellence.\n### \nThe twelfth edition of SCROLLS (Students’ Creative and Oratory Learning Skills)

content_chunk: "# GARBA Navratri festival\n### \nOn 29th November 2024
column4: a vibrant Garba Night filled with traditional dances
column5: festive music
column6: and unforgettable memories. The evening began with Durga Vandana followed by energetic Garba and Dandiya performances. A skit by the girl students of Goonj Society of the college was played depicting the Indian culture and a motivating message to young students to dedicate themselves towards regaining of India’s name and fame and love towards the nation. All the performances embraced the night
column7: shining brilliantly and leaving an unforgettable mark.\nWith stunning decorations and delicious traditional delicacies
column8: the night beautifully celebrated unity and culture. With the energy of the crowd and the enchanting ambiance
column9: the celebration ended with cheers for Miss Garba and heartfelt memories that will be cherished forever.\n### \nOn 11th December 2023 Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College
column10: Ghaziabad
column11: hosted a vibrant and colorful Garba Night at the Girls Hostel. The event
column13: brought together students and faculty for an evening filled with music
column14: dance
column15: and festive cheer.\nThe event featured graceful and dynamic dance performances
column16: a melodious musical showcase
column17: spirited games and the lively ‘Miss Garba’ contest
column18: shining a spotlight on the talent of fourth-year participants. The decoration captivated everyone’s attention.\nThe event was a grand success
column19: fostering a sense of community and cultural appreciation among attendees. It ended with a heartful speech by Director General Sir and a promise to make the next event even bigger and better.\n### \n“The rhythm of tradition in the psalm of life
column20: Enriched with festivity
column21: love and elation
column22: We witness the artistry of this wondrous night
column23: Rising to an epitome of cheerful celebration.""\nGarba
column24: a breath-taking extravaganza
column25: a plethora of colors and an emblem of grandeur that culminates the monotony of everyday life
column26: is celebrated as an annual hostel event – a shimmery evening of togetherness and festivity with an expression of gratitude to the faculty members from students and a reverent laudation to the seniors passing out.\nThis year also Garba was celebrated on 27 September
column27: 2018 with the theme ABHIJISHYA
column28:
meaning strong and independent women and it was proved by the enthusiasm and humongous participation by the girls leading to the success of this beautiful and elegant event.
The bang on performances of our beauty with brains that is fourth year girls competing for the titles of Ms. Garba and Ms. Personality were cherished by all and offered a tough task for the senior faculty as judges to evaluate them. At last Shagun Singh and Vartika Raj won the title of Ms. Garba and Ms. Personality respectively.
### 
KRITAGYA'19
column29: the Garba Night at AKGEC brought forward for us a tide of happiness and hope that left behind a memory that will be remembered as an oasis of serendipity.\nThe beautifully and intricately decorated premises of Girls Hostel welcomed the dignitaries including our Director General
column30: Dr. R.K. Agarwal
column31: Dean Student Welfare
column32: Dean Hostels
column33: Proctor
column34: Heads of Departments
column35: Section Incharges and faculty and their families to theTo the annual Garba night celebration. \nThe program
column36: on the evening of 4 October
column38: was inaugurated with the lighting of lamp followed by Ganesh Vandana. The concoction of dance
column39: song and skit performances by the students left the guests mesmerized. The highlight of the night was the Miss Garba and Miss Personality contest won by Ms. Saloni Agarwal and Ms. Shubhi Rajpoot respectively through the series of introduction
column40: performance and questionnaire rounds. The games for the faculty and their families added fun to the colorful evening.\nThe event ended on a happy note with the DJ for the students to thrill the celebration.\n  * 27th Km Milestone

content_chunk: "# Independence Day\nAKGEC proudly celebrated the 79th Independence Day with immense enthusiasm and national pride. The ceremony commenced with the hoisting of the national flag
column5: and heartfelt tributes to the nation’s freedom fighters. Faculty
column6: staff
column7: and students joined together to honour the spirit of independence and reflect on India’s journey of progress. The occasion also served as a pledge to uphold the values of freedom
column8: unity
column9: and responsibility
column10: while reaffirming our collective commitment to contribute towards the nation’s future growth and development.\n77th Independence day on 15 Aug 2023 was celebrated at Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College
column11: Ghaziabad with great enthusiasm and fanfare.\nUnder the HAR GHAR TIRANGA program
column12: 76th Independence day on 15 Aug 2022 was celebrated at Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College
column13: Ghaziabad with great enthusiasm and fanfare. Following programs were held:\n(a) Flag hoisting at 10:00 AM in the college front lawn.(b) Cultural Program by college students and distribution of awards to class IV employees of the college for excellent performance.(c) Address by the Dr R.K Agarwal
column14: Director General of the college .(d) HAR GHAR TIRANGA route march by college students
column15: faculty and staff. Director General Dr. R.K Agarwal and all HoDs & Deans marched along with students .\nThe Program was seen lived on YouTube link\nAKGEC celebrated the nation’s 75th Independence day on 15 August
column16: 2021. Director General
column17: Dr. R.K. Agarwal
column18: hoisted the National Flag in the presence of Heads of Departments
column19: Deans
column20: faculty and staff. In his address to the audience
column21: Dr. Agarwal stated that the Independence Day reminds every Indian about the dawn of a new beginning
column22: the beginning of an era of liberation from the oppression during the British Raj of more than 200 years. It is the day to remember and pay homage to the martyrs
column23: revolutionaries and freedom fighters who sacrificed their lives so that we
column24: the future generations
column25: could live
column26: grow and prosper in a free nation. It is also the day for us to dedicate ourselves to the service of our nation and work towards fulfilling their aspirations and dreams of a peaceful
column27: developed
column28: prosperous and happy nation. He stressed that all we need to do is to do our work/ duties with utmost sincerity
column29: be a law abiding conscientious citizen and a good human being with sound ethics
column30: moral values
column31: positive attitude and concern for others.\nIn view of the Covid 19 pandemic
column32: the celebrations were constrained under the norms of social distancing.\nDistribution of sweets amidst the playing of patriotic songs marked the end of the celebrations.\nAKGEC celebrated the nation’s 74th Independence day on 15 August
column33: 2020. Director General
column34: Dr. R.K. Agarwal hoisted the National Flag in the presence of Heads of Departments
column36: faculty and staff. In his address to the audience
column37: Dr. Agarwal emphasized on the need for each one of us to fulfill our responsibilities of sincerity
column38: truthfulness and hard work to be good citizens of the country. He stressed that this contribution alone from each one of us will contribute greatly towards nation building.\nIn view of the Covid 19 pandemic
column39: the celebrations were constrained under the norms of social distancing.\nDistribution of sweets amidst the playing of patriotic songs marked the end of the celebrations.\n  * 27th Km Milestone

content_chunk: "# Vishwakarma Puja\nAKGEC celebrated Vishwakarma Puja on 17th September 2025 at 9:30 am
column3: in the Mechanical Engineering Workshop with great devotion. The puja was performed by Advisor Prof. Amita Dev and Director AKGEC
column5: and attended by Director AKGIM
column6: HoDs
column8: Faculty
column9: Staff
column10: and Students. Everyone offered prayers to Lord Vishwakarma
column11: seeking blessings for the smooth functioning of tools and machinery. The celebration reflected inclusivity
column13: and the spirit of engineering excellence at AKGEC.\nAKGEC celebrated Vishwakarma Puja on September 17
column15: in the Mechanical Engineering Workshop
column16: honoring Lord Vishwakarma
column17: the divine architect of the universe. The event
column18: attended by HoDs
column19: Deans
column20: Professors
column21: Section Incharges
column22: staff
column23: and students
column24: highlighted the inclusivity and importance of the celebration within the academic community. Participants offered prayers
column25: seeking blessings for the smooth functioning of tools and machinery
column26: which play a crucial role in engineering and technology. The ceremony reinforced a sense of reverence for the equipment integral to their work and studies.\nVishwakarma Puja is a significant day of celebration
column27: dedicated to Lord Vishwakarma
column28: the divine architect and engineer of the universe. It is a day when people offer prayers and seek blessings for their tools
column30: and instruments as well as Lord Vishwakarma's idol.\nThe celebration of Vishwakarma Puja symbolizes the recognition of the importance of technology and craftsmanship in the field of engineering and education. It also serves as a way to invoke divine blessings for the success and safety of all equipment and machinery used in teaching and research.We all pay homage to Lord Vishwakarma and seek his blessings for the smooth functioning of tools and machinery
column31: which are integral to the field of engineering and technology.\nAKGEC celebrated “VISHWAKARMA PUJA” on September 17
column33: at 9:30 am in the Mechanical Engineering Workshop. The event was attended by a diverse group of individuals
column34: including Heads of Departments (HoDs)
column36: Professors
column37: Section Incharges
column38: and Lab Assistants. This reflects the importance and inclusivity of the celebration within the academic community. Additionally
column39: students from various years also participated in the puja
column40: emphasizing the involvement of the student body.\nVishwakarma Puja is a day of celebration for Vishwakarma
column42: the divine architect. He is considered as swayambhu and creator of the world. He constructed the holy city of Dwarka where Krishna ruled
column43: the palace of Indraprastha for the Pandavas
column44: and was the creator of many fabulous weapons for the gods. He is also called the divine carpenter
column45: and is mentioned in the Rig Veda
column46: and is credited with Sthapatya Veda
column47: the science of mechanics and architecture.\nAKGEC celebrated “VISHWAKARMA PUJA” on 17th September 2022 (Saturday) in the Mechanical Engineering Department Workshop at 9:30 am. All HoDs
column48: Deans
column49: Professors and Section Incharges along with all other personnel free from essential duties of the college attended the Puja.\n  * 27th Km Milestone

content_chunk:
"# Yoga Day
### 
(a) Around 120 students are being trained on daily Yoga w.e.f 5 th June 2023 under Patanjali trained Yoga Acharya Shri Omkarji.
(b) Yoga on 20 th June 2023- HoDs
column4: faculty and staff (Approximate 120) performed yoga under invited Yoga expert Col.M.K.Pandey
column5:
Patanjali trained.
(c) Yoga on 21 st June 2023
(i) 30 faculty/staff and 750 students of hostels performed yoga on College football ground from 6:30 to 7:15 a.m. under Yoga Acharya Shri Omkarji.
(ii) Director General
column6: Director
column8: Dean and College faculty and staff (approximately 120) performed yoga under invited Yoga expert Col.M.K.Pandey
column9:
Patanjali trained.
### 
The International Yoga Day is celebrated on June 21 every year to spread awareness about the important health benefits of practising yoga since 2015.
Yoga not only provides physical and mental relaxation but also develops strength and resilience. The numerous benefits of Yoga make it a popular practice for people across the globe
column10: especially in times of a pandemic when mental and physical health is under stress. Beyond its immediate impact on physical health
column11: the COVID-19 pandemic has also exacerbated psychological suffering and mental health problems
column13: due to the pandemic-related restrictions and its after effects.\nThe message of Yoga in promoting both the physical and mental well-being of humanity has never been more relevant. A growing trend of people around the world embracing Yoga to stay healthy and rejuvenated and to fight social isolation and depression has been witnessed during the pandemic. Yoga is also playing a significant role in the psycho-social care and rehabilitation of COVID-19 patients in quarantine and isolation. It is particularly helpful in allaying their fears and anxiety.\nRecognizing this important role of Yoga
column14: the commemoration of the International Day of Yoga in 2021 focused on “Yoga for well-being” – how the practice of Yoga can promote the holistic health of every individual.\nLike the year 2020
column15: faculty and staff of AKGEC practiced Yoga at home with their families and shared their pictures with the College. Colonel M.K. Pandey
column16: Retired
column17: guided the faculty and staff through the yogasans online.\n### \nBased on the proposal by our great Prime Minister
column18: Shri Narendra Modi
column19: during his first address to the UN general assembly
column20: and realizing the importance of yoga practices in maintaining mental and physical wellbeing
column21: United Nations declared 21 June as International Yoga Day on 11Dec 2014. The objective of this day is to be sensitize and remind people across the globe about the benefits of yoga. Since then our college has been observing the Yoga Day every year by organizing Yoga sessions for faculty
column22: staff and students. College has also been organizing yoga sessions for the benefit of faculty and staff during June and July and for the students during the Orientation period.\nOn account of the Covid 19 pandemic
column23: the college advised all its members to celebrate the Yoga Day safely from home along with their family members on 21 June
column24: 2020.\n  * 27th Km Milestone
