content_chunk: "# FDPs\n### \nThe Department of Mechanical Engineering at Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College successfully concluded a five-day ICT-based Faculty Development Programme on “Green Manufacturing”
column3: from 29th Jan – 2nd Feb 2024 in collaboration with NITTTR
column4: Chandigarh. This achievement aimed at fostering both academic and research growth amongst faculty participants through practical case studies on Green approaches and initiatives towards sustainability in manufacturing domain. A total of 49 faculty participants from renowned Engineering Institutes/Universities registered and actively participated through our AKGEC Remote Center. The active engagement of overall 91 participants from three remote centers and contributions from various speakers from institutes of national eminence
column5: Dr. Pallab Biswas (HOD ME)
column6:
and local coordinators Dr. Suman Gothwal and Mr. H.S. Chausiya significantly contributed to the program’s success.
TAG THESE COLLEGES  
---  
1 | NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF TECHNICAL TEACHERS TRAINING & RESEARCH
column7:
CHANDIGARH  
2 | AJAY KUMAR GARG ENGINEERING COLLEGE  
3 | JNTUA COLLEGE OF ENGINEERING (AUTONOMOUS) PULIVENDULA  
4 | OP JINDAL UNIVERSITY  
5 | ADGIPS  
6 | KIET GROUP OF INSTITUTIONS  
7 | DR. AKHILESH DAS GUPTA INSTITUTE OF PROFESSIONAL STUDIES

9 | VIGNAN INSTITUTE OF MANAGEMENT AND TECHNOLOGY FOR WOMEN  
10 | GALGOTIAS UNIVERSITY GREATER NOIDA  
11 | JSS ACADEMY OF TECHNICAL EDUCATION NOIDA  
### 
Department of Computer Science and Engineering conducted the Faculty Development Program (Short term course in online mode) on the topic “Complex Networks Analysis using Python” at remote center Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College Ghaziabad in collaboration with Department of Computer Science and Engineering
column8: National Institute of Technical Teachers Training & Research (NITTTR)
column9: Chandigarh
column10: from 15 January 2024 to 19 January 2024.\nA total of 62 participants registered for the FDP. The course covered wide span of the topics: Introduction to Graph Theory and Python
column11: Visualization of Graphs using Network X
column12: Case Study on Biological Network Analysis and Gephi Tool
column13: Beyond Nodes and Edges and Hands-on implementation using Python. The FDP was conducted under esteem guidance of course coordinator Er. Sahno Solanki
column14: Associate Professor
column15: CSE
column16: NITTTR Chandigarh and coordinated by local coordinator Dr Shashank Sahu
column17: Professor CSE
column18: AKGEC and coordinator Dr Santosh Kumar Upadhyay
column19: Associate Professor
column20:
CSE AKGEC.
The course was conducted in three sessions and all participants enriched their knowledge by sessions eminent speakers of the FDP. The speakers of the sessions elaborated the topics from beginning to advanced level and showcased the application of the concepts using python programming. FDP was concluded on 19 January 2024 by sharing of feedback and discussion from all participants.
### 
Department of Information Technology
column21: Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College
column22: Ghaziabad has organized a five day Faculty Development Programme on “UNBLOCK BLOCKCHAIN” in online mode from 1-5 August 2022. The FDP programme received an overwhelming response with 94 participants from various Engineering Colleges/ Universities.\nThe FDP inaugurated on 1st August 2022 at 9:00 AM with the welcome speech of Dr. Anu Chaudhary
column23: HoD IT. Followed by the address of Chief Guest Mr. Satish Chauhan Director Oracle India Pvt Ltd. He motivated FDP participants with his informative and encouraging words. Keynote Address had given by Mr. Ajay Singh
column24: CTO
column25: DLT Labs and welcome speech and vote of thanks by Dr. Aditya Pratap Singh
column27: IT Department.\nDay 1
column28: first session was taken by Dr. Ferdous Ahmed Barbhuiya who is an Associate Professor at the Indian Institute of Information Technology Guwahati
column29: in the department of Computer Science & Engineering. He is also the Associate Dean of Administration at IIT Guwahati provided excellent
column30: interactive and informative session on Blockchain Technology and its Architecture. Next session was taken by Dr. Raju Halder an Associate Professor in the Dept. of Comp. Sc. and Engg. at IIT Patna. He had taken the session on Cryptocurrency and its mining process.\nDay 2
column31: first session was continued by Dr. Raju Halder
column32: IIT Patna. He took the session on Security aspects of blockchain. He also discussed about the procedure of tamper-proof ledger of transactions in blockchain. The second session was taken by Dr. P. Raghu Vamsi
column33: Assistant Professor senior grade
column34: JIIT Noida. He delivered his session on Blockchain use cases and he also discussed few case studies and various parameters for selecting blochchain based projects.\nDay 3
column36: JIIT Noida had continued rest of the sessions of day 3. In the first session he discussed about solidity Smart Contracts – Solidity programming
column37: Designing and coding solidity smart contracts. Second session was on building Blockchain Decentralized Applications – Linking Solidity smart contracts to Web Applications.\nDay 4
column38: first session was taken by Dr. Amit Singhal
column39: Professor & Head in Department of Computer Science & Engineering (IOT) in Raj Kumar Goel Institute of Technology
column40: Ghaziabad. He took the session on Cryptography in Blockchain Technology. He discussed the use of cryptography to protect user privacy and transaction information and ensure data consistency in the blockchain.\nSecond session was taken by Dr. Anupama Sharma
column42: IT Department. She discussed the applications and use cases of blockchain in various fields as well as the companies and startups involved in these applications worldwide. Session was continued by Dr. Amrita Jyoti
column43: Assistant Professor
column44: IT Department. She discussed about crowd funding application of blockchain. She had also given hands on experience to the participants on metamask.\nDay 5 sessions were taken by Mr. Purushottam Chaudhary
column45: Principal Blockchain Architect at DLT Labs. He provided excellent hands on sessions with making small blockchain applications.\nFeedbacks from all the participants were collected for all the sessions. E-certificates were mailed to the participants. FDP was very beneficial for participants
column46: they learnt about the scope of blockchain
column47: security features in blockchain
column48: primitives of the distributed computing and cryptography related to blockchain
column49: they will be able to write smart contract using Ethereum Framework
column50: they may be able to come out with a new idea for smart contract in real-world applications. FDP was successful and participants have gained very good knowledge on blockchain technology.\n### \nAICTE has launched scheme for the establishment of IDEA (Idea development
column51: Evaluation & Application) Lab in AICTE approved institutions
column52: encouraging students for application of Science
column53: Technology
column54: Engineering & Mathematics (STEM) fundamentals towards enhanced hands-on learning and learning by doing experience. AKGEC FAB Lab is one of the mentor labs for this IDEA lab scheme.\nTo take the AICTE initiative forward
column55: AKGEC is organized a five day FDP under AICTE Training & Learning (ATAL) Academy to train the coordinators and co-coordinators of newly formed IDEA Labs across the country during 23-27 August
column56: 2021 at AKGEC FAB Lab.\nCo-ordinators of IDEA Lab from thirteen States across the country including West Bengal
column57: Andhra Pradesh
column58: Orissa
column59: Haryana
column60: Uttar Pradesh
column61: Maharashtra
column62: Tamil Nadu and Madhya Pradesh attended the experienshal FDP characterized by thought provoking discussions and cross fertilization of ideas.\nThe Inaugural Ceremony of the FDP was held on 23 August
column63: 2021. The Chief Guest for the ceremony was Sh. Rakesh Ranjan
column64: IAS
column65: Hon’ble Additional Secretary
column67: Ministry of Education Govt. of India. Dignitaries including Dr. Neeraj Saxena
column68: Advisor
column69: AICTE and Members of National Steering Committee of IDEA Lab also graced the occasion with their presence. The speakers during the Inaugural Ceremony stressed in unison on the urgent need for a transformation in the education paradigm from an examination system to a hands on experience which is the concept behind the establishment of IDEA Labs across the country.\n### \nA five days Faculty Development Programme (FDP) on “Emerging Trends of Information Technologies and Its Applications” was successfully conducted (Online Mode) by the Department of Information Technology
column70: Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College
column71: Ghaziabad. FDP was sponsored by AKTU
column72: Lucknow and Conducted during 16th – 20th December 2020.\nThe main aim of this FDP was to discuss the latest and emerging trends of information technology and its related applications where people could explore new dimensions of research and implementation. This program provided an opportunity to interact with various experts and eminent personnel of reputed institutions (like IITs.
column73: JNU etc.) and Also People from industries (Software Industries) shared their knowledge and experiences with the participants.\nThis platform enhances the knowledge and encourages the faculty members and researchers working in different areas of information technologies to explore more in these domains. The FDP also focused on different research applications and various unresolved challenges in modern research areas. The FDP programme received an overwhelming response with 72 participants (Registered and Successfully Attended FDP) from various colleges affiliated to AKTU
column74: Lucknow.\nThe participants have acquired knowledge of the different aspects of designing
column75:
planning and delivering different applications and research models for teaching-learning and also about the appropriate developmental tools needed to develop e-content in their respective disciplines.
After successful completion of FDP participants have been given E-certificates.
### 
An online Short Term Training Program (STTP) on “Data Science with Python” sponsored by AICTE was organized by Department of Computer Science & Engineering at Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College
column76: Ghaziabad in three phases: • 1st Phase: 2-7 November 2020 • 2nd Phase: 7-12 December 2020 • 3rd Phase: 14-19 December 2020.\nTotal 147 participants (including all three STTP sessions) from across India attended the STTP and got benefited.\nThe STTP was conducted as an initiative to enrich the knowledge of faculty members through interaction with eminent personalities and resource persons from various academic institutions. The speakers enriched the knowledge of participants on Current Research Trends in Data Science and its applications. They focused on the importance of this technology in multiple industries including Financial Services
column78: Government
column79: Travel. Sessions also included Machine Learning Algorithms with Data Science. Hands on session on data analytics with python was also conducted. The implementation of advanced Machine Learning models and the various implementations of Data Science in the field of research were also discussed.\nFor all the sessions of the STTP
column80: feedback from the participants was collected. E-certificates were mailed to the participants. Overall this STTP was beneficial and knowledgeable experience for all the participants to learn about the significance of Data Science and its applications. Besides this the participants gained knowledge in the field of Data Science and its implementation in the real world applications.\n### \nA five day online FDP on Advancement In Building Technologies was organized by Department of Civil Engineering during 10–14 August
column81: 2020. The FDP was conducted as an initiative to enrich the knowledge of faculty members through interaction with eminent resource persons from Industry and Academia.\n86 participants from CSIR-CRRI New Delhi
column82: AL-Fallah University
column83: Acupace Technologies Pvt. Ltd.
column84: NHPC Ltd.
column86: Gwalior
column87: IIT Roorkee
column88: IIT Delhi
column89: Manjari Foundation
column90: IIT Kharagpur
column91: NIT Srinagar and other institutes and industry participated in the FDP and got benefited.\nThe resource persons included Dr. Shishir Chandra Bhaduri
column92: Dean
column93: Bhartiya Skill Development University
column94: Jaipur and Er. A. K. Sharma
column97: Ghaziabad has conducted Online Faculty Development Program on Machine Learning and its Applications using python during 29 June – 3 July 2020.The main objective of conducting this Online FDP is to address the recent trends in the research and applications of machine learning. The idea behind is to aware with the basics concepts of Machine Learning (ML)
column98: the implementation of algorithms of ML using Python
column99: working with various libraries required for ML and inspiration for further research.This FDP is also aimed to motivating the faculty members
column100: research scholars and industry professionals to encourage their interests in machine learning technologies. It will enable theoretical and practical understanding of the most popular machine learning tools and techniques applicable in various domains by the eminent speakers.\nThis online FDP was organized with the collaboration of Consilio Intelligence Research Lab
column105: UP & Dr. H. S. Gour Vishwavidyalaya
column107: MP.\nThe patron of this FDP was Dr. R. K Agarwal
column110: Ghaziabad. The chief guest of FDP was Dr. Raghuraj Singh (Professor & Head
column114: UP) and the speakers were Dr. Yamuna Prasad Shukla (Assistant Professor
column128: New Delhi) and Mr. Ghanshyam Jaiswal (Team Leader
column131: UP). The experts’ talks included different topics like Basics of Machine Learning with Python
column132: Classification Methods for ML using Python
column133: Implementation of ANN and KNN for classification and regression using Python
column134: ML Algorithm with Clustering and Associations using Python and Case study using Python.\nMore than 500 participants were shortlisted from more than 1100 registrations to attend the FDP. We got the participation from almost all states of India including Tamil Nadu
column142: Madhya Pradesh and Andhra Pradesh. Many participants were also from others countries like South Korea
column145: Nigeria and Ethiopia.\n### \nFive day FDP on Power System Operation and its Control was organized by Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering during 13-17 January
column146:
2020.
The resource persons for the FDP were drawn from leading institutes.
**Speaker** | **Topic Delivered**  
---|---  
Dr. Mohit BansalProf. & HOD (EN) G L Bajaj ITM
column147:
Greater Noida | Phase Measurement Unit  
Dr. Amit JainAssociate Professor (EE) IIT Delhi | Role of Power Electronics in PSOC  
Dr. J.S. LatherProfessor (EE) NIT Kurukshetra | DC Micro grid scenario in Power System.  
Load Frequency Control and Active Power Compensation  
Dr. Omveer SinghProfessor (EE) Gautam Budh University Greater Noida | Power System Design  
Voltage Stability and its Compensation  
Dr. Pradeep KumarAssistant Professor (EE) NIT Kurukshetra | Power System Restructuring and Biding  
Economic Operations of Power System  
Dr. M.P. DaveProfessor (EE) Shiv Nadar | HVDC  
Decentralized Power Generation System  
The FDP will be of immense use to the participants in expanding their knowledge sphere and delivery to the students. The FDP was participated by 27 faculty members.
### 
Intellectual property (IP) is a category of property that includes intangible creations of the human intellect. There are many types of intellectual property such as copyrights
column149: trademarks and trade secrets. Intellectual Property Rights (IPR) are the exclusive rights given to persons over the creations of their minds for a certain period of time. IPR plays a key role in gaining advantageous position to promote the economic growth of our nation.\nWorkshop on IPR was conducted at AKGEC on 12 October
column156: covered the various aspects of IPR including IPR agreement administration
column158: the Indian scenario of Intellectual property system and the Office of the Controller General of Patents
column160: Department of Industrial Policy and Promotion
column161: the roles and functions of Intellectual property Office in India
column162: the process of filing the Patent application
column165:
Design application and the Scheme for Facilitating Start-ups Intellectual Property Protection.
The informative and interactive session kindle the minds of the attendees through various queries highlighting the importance of documenting ideas properly and patenting them.
### 
Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College
column167: organized two day workshop for the Resource Persons of three week Students Induction Program (SIP) to be conducted for B.Tech first year students. The SIP
column169: is primarily to make the students comfortable in the new environment and expose them with various facets of life
column170: with emphasis on holistic approach towards life in the light of Universal Human Values. The objective of this workshop
column173: was to contemplate and strengthen the process and contents of SIP and its effectiveness by virtue of the methods and procedures adopted so far.\nThe event commenced with the inaugural ceremony graced by eminent functionaries from AICTE & National Coordinator Committee – Induction Program (NCC-IP) – Prof. Rajive Kumar
column174: Member Secretary AICTE; Dr. Manoj Tiwari
column175: Regional Officer NRO – AICTE; Prof. Rajneesh Arora
column176: Chairman NCC-IP and Dr. Shishir Gaur
column178: Director AKGEC (Host College) welcomed all the dignitaries and 88 delegates from AKTU affiliated colleges and seven different states as participants of the workshop. In his address
column179: Director emphasized value based education for developing holistic perspective and a way of living for the well-being of all. He offered that college resources will be put at the complete disposal of AICTE and NCC-IP for implementation of Universal Human Values and Student Induction programs at all India level.\nProf. Rajneesh Arora projected that the focus of the two day workshop was to review the SIP program and to discuss ideas and proposals for refinement of the program. He expressed his happiness that AICTE has got this scheme implemented on a pan India level in all engineering colleges.\nProf Rajive Kumar
column181: expressed that AICTE is committed to a full time support in any form and all financial help for effective implementation of program.\nDr. M P Poonia
column183: AICTE also graced the event little late in the afternoon and held a meeting with Director
column184: AKGEC and all the functionaries of AICTE & NCC-IP.\n### \nDepartment of Mechanical Engineering at Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College
column186: organized a three days Faculty Development Program (FDP) on **Additive Manufacturing** from 26th August 2019 to 30th August 2019.\nThe objectives of the program included technical know-how and hands on experience in the recent trends in Additive Manufacturing like FDM
column187: SLS and other areas of industrial automation
column189: fostering the learning of new skills and knowledge and upgrading the skill set of the faculty in order to include technological advancement.\nThe sessions were conducted by eminent Professors from reputed Institutes – Prof. Pulak Mohan Pandey from IIT Delhi
column190: Prof. Sachin Maheshwari from Netaji Subhas University
column192: Prof. Arshad Noor Siddiquee from Jamia Millia Islamia University New Delhi
column193: Prof. Vikas Rastogi from Delhi Technological University
column194: New Delhi and Dr. Rajeev Agrawal from MNIT Jaipur. The speakers shared their valuable knowledge with the participants to enhance their know-how and professional acumen and motivated them to research in the field of Additive Manufacturing (3D Printing).\nApart from the class room sessions
column195: the practical exposure was also given to the participants at AKGEC Skills Foundation (ASF) Centres and on the 3-D Printing facilities available in the department of Mechanical Engineering. A good number of faculty members and research scholars from various Engineering institutes participated and penned down a very encouraging feedback on the FDP.\n### \nDepartment of Computer Science and Engineering conducted five day Faculty Development Program (FDP) on **Current Research Trends in Artificial Neural Networks** during 8 – 12 July

content_chunk:
"# Industry Interaction
### 
AKGEC IDEA Lab (Technical Business Incubator) organized Startup Conclave- 2021 sponsored by DLT Labs on 30 November 2021 to promote the entrepreneurship ecosystem in the college. The Startup Conclave-2021was aimed to nurture innovative ideas and start-ups from the college and offer them a platform to explore the world of entrepreneurship to start new ventures.
The event was graced by the presence of Dr. R.K. Agarwal
column4: AKGEC along with the honorable guests – Mr. Dharmendra Singh
column5: Deputy Executive Director
column6: Shriram Pistons and Rings Pvt ltd. & President GMA; Mr. Sushil Aggarwal
column8: AVRO India Pvt. Ltd.; Dr. Mohit Gambhir
column9: Innovation Director
column10: Ministry of Education
column11: Government of India; Mr. Neeraj Srivastava
column13: DLT Labs and Mr. Vivek Srivastava
column14: Director
column15: Commercial and Finance
column16: DLT Labs. The Deans
column17: Heads of Departments
column18: faculty members
column19: Alumni and students of AKGEC were also present in the event.\nDuring the inaugural ceremony
column20: Director General
column21: AKGEC
column22: and the guests shared their knowledge and experiences with the audience. A total of 37 start-up teams participated in the pitching
column23: and 8 teams were selected to be incubated by the college. The selected teams were awarded an initial grant of Rs 10
column24: 000 and will be provided seed funding of up to Rs 3
column26: 000 after the probation period. This year
column27: AKGEC also invited its alumni for the first Startup Excellence Award for Alumni. Three startups were awarded Rs. 20
column28: 000 each and trophy as a token of appreciation by the college. Truck Suvidha
column30: and Exeliq Tech Solutions were among the awardees.\nDLT Labs – Global Leader in Enterprise Blockchain solutions
column31: sponsored the entire event. Mr. Neeraj Srivastava
column32: Founder & CTO of DLT Labs and an AKGEC alumni
column33: shared his inspiring journey and motivated the participants to take on the challenges and pursue their dreams.\nThe event concluded with the Vote of Thanks by Mr. Rahul Sharma
column34: Head
column36:
AKGEC.
### 
5th International Congress (IC-2020) on “Advanced Welding Technology & Quality Systems for Developing Economies"" was organized during 6th -8th Feb' 2020 at Mumbai by the International Institute of Welding and hosted by The Indian Institute of Welding (IIW India).
It was attended by more than 350 National and International Delegates representing various Industries related to welding & allied fields
column37: academic & research institutions and National / International welding Associations & Professional Bodies.\nConcurrently WELDINDIA 2020 – a three day exhibition was held during 7-9 February
column38: 2020 at CIDCO Exhibition Centre
column39: New Mumbai. More than 100 companies from Metallurgy
column40: Material Testing & NDT
column42: Fabricating & allied products industries showcased their latest development and professional branding in the Indian as well as international market during the exhibition.\nAKGEC participated in the Congress as one of its sponsors and exhibited its training
column43: research and consultancy facilities under AKGEC Skills Foundation in the WELD INDIA 2020 Exhibition.\n### \nAKGEC Skills Foundation (ASF) participated in DefExpo-2020
column44: an event of the Ministry of Defense
column45: Government of India
column46: held at Lucknow during 5-9 February
column47: 2020\nThe theme of the 11th edition of the Expo was ‘India: The Emerging Defense Manufacturing Hub’ and the focus was on ‘Digital Transformation of Defense’.\nDefexpo was inaugurated by Honorable Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi and was attended by Raksha Mantri Shri Rajnath Singh along with Chief Minister
column48: Uttar Pradesh
column49: Shri Yogi Adityanath.\nThe Expo presented the latest technologies like Industrial Robotics
column50: Automation
column51: Digital Manufacturing
column52: 3D Printing
column53: Scanning & IoT. The event was followed by live demonstration of Naval Systems
column54: Aero Systems and Land Systems designed/built in India. Delegates from 70 countries and 172 foreign military manufacturers attended the five day mega exhibition.\nASF Stall was visited by several professionals engaged in Defense production
column55: procurement and service industries. The prominent ones were the visit of Chief of Defense Staff
column56: India
column57: General Bipin Rawat and Shri Vinay Mohan Srivastava
column58: General Manager
column59: Modern Coach Factory (MCF)
column60: Indian Railways. DefExpo provided an excellent opportunity to ASF to showcase the cutting-edge technologies that can help in achieving the digital transformation of Defense.\n### \nStudents of Mechanical Engineering visited the National Science Centre
column61: Delhi on 26 August
column62: 2019. The visit proved to be an effective means to arouse the curiosity of innovation in the young minds and was a motivating experience. The Science Centre showcased a whole world of wonder and amazement with a plethora of exhibits on Space Technology
column63: Information and Communication Technology
column64: Oceanography and Earth Sciences
column65: Agricultural Technology
column67: Nanotechnology
column68: Energy and Transportation Technology and many more.\nThe students gained useful knowledge from the various fun filled innovative activities and the exhibits. They watched four movies- The Development of Information and Communication Technology
column69: Inside a Nuclear Power Plant (by NPCIL)
column70: The Tragedy of Partition and Integration of Indian States by Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel. Watching each of these movies was a great learning experience.\n### \nAKGEC organized ‘Rozgar Mela’ in association with Automotive Skills Development Council (ASDC) on 20 November2018 for recruitment of Diploma / ITI students who underwent training under various skill development programs at the Centres of Excellence
column71: AKGEC. The recruitment drive in the automotive sector was attended by dealers of TATA Motors along with Technical Head
column72: ASDC and Territory Sales Manager
column73: TATA Motors. Total 180 candidates were interviewed out of which 16 got selected while 25 candidates are in waiting list.\n### \nIDEA (Innovation
column74: Development
column76: AKGEC organized three day Entrepreneurship Awareness Camp during 15-17 November
column78: sponsored by Entrepreneurship Development Institute of India and supported by Department of Science and Technology
column79: Government of India.\nThe objective of the camp was to create awareness among the students of Engineering and Science courses about various facts of entrepreneurship as an alternative career option and also highlight the merits of pursuing such an options to promote Entrepreneurship in our country.The camp was attended by 120 students of B.Tech III year.\nApart from sessions conducted by Mr. HP Singh Consultant
column81: Noida and Mr. Shakeel Ahamd Khan
column82: Consultant NSIC Delhi
column83: the EAC consisted of interface with entrepreneurs
column84: legal experts and finance experts on various aspects of entrepreneurship.\n### \nAjay Kumar Garg Engineering College in its endeavor to ensure holistic development of its students and make them excel in all domains of life has been organizing various events and activities with a blend of achieving individual talents and innovation among the students. TECHNOVATION 2018
column85: a National Contest for Innovative Product and Prototyping
column86: was organized by the Institute. The principal sponsor for this event was Stratasys India
column87: a leading multinational company in additive manufacturing.\nThe contest provided a platform for promoting Innovation and Creativity among young engineering students by inviting fresh ideas related to the themes namely Lifestyle & Smart Appliances
column88: Transportation
column89: Agriculture
column90: Energy
column91: Defense and Manufacturing. The theme based exposition was aimed to harness the potential ideas
column92: concepts and technologies in any form available with the students.\nBest 20 ideas were selected and given opportunity to develop working prototypes at AKGEC FabLab to showcase actual implementation of idea into reality. The teams were invited to present their prototypes with brief presentation to the nominated jury. Best selected ideas were given awards worth Rs 3
column94: 000/- during the award ceremony on 30th August
column96: the winning teams also got an opportunity to undergo three days training on 3D printing at Stratasys Experience Centre at Bangalore.\nChief Guest
column97: Prof. N.S. Vyas
column98: Chairman Railway Technology Mission and Senior Professor
column99: IIT Kanpur; Guest of Honour
column106: M.D. Stratasys India Pvt. Ltd.; Director Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College
column110: along with senior officials from various Organizations including Studio 34
column112: BCH Electric Ltd. etc. were present during the award ceremony.\n  * 27th Km Milestone

content_chunk: "# Innovations During Covid 19 Pandemic\nDuring the Covid 19 pandemic
column3: AKGEC FabLab developed a low cost yet environmental friendly and reusable products – Respirator and Face shield using 3D printing Technology.\nThe respirator was developed using Polylactic Acid. The filter material used was disposable mask cloth but any material as per exposed environment can be used. Design considerations such as suitability for average male / female face size with ergonomic characteristics and perfect fit on the face without causing any problems due to prolonged usage were taken into consideration. The weight of the respirator was 47 grams and average cost of manufacture was INR 100.\nThe face shield was developed using 3D printed visor
column4: A4 transparent plastic sheet (175 microns thickness) and elastic (hair rubber band). The material used per shield was 8 grams industry grade PLA. The printing time was 32 minutes and the assembly time 2 minutes. The average cost of manufacturing of the shield was INR 90.\n  * 27th Km Milestone

content_chunk: "# Open Source Software R&D Center\nIn the present day scenario
column3: the open source software is replacing the proprietary software because of manifold advantages they have over proprietary software. Even though Free/Open Source Software (FOSS) is widely used
column4: much of the computer science research community has yet to fully recognise its potential to change the world of research and developement of software intensive systems across disciplines.\nThe establishment of this research and development centre is expected to create a unique opportunity to all stake holders of the institute. The facility so created shall be useful to carry out research/developement/training/consultancy related to open source software. The centre will customize the open source software according to the requirements. It will also train the students and facilities of our institute and will involve them in the developement and customisation of recent open source software.\nThe Open Source Software Research and Developement Center will function in Computer Science & Engineering Department under the supervision of Dr. Anu Chaudhary
column5: HoD CSE. The Composition of the team
column6: the functionaries and the funtion to be performed are listed below:-\nAdvisory Board\nDr. R.K. Agarwal
column8: AKGEC (Chairman) Dr. Anu Chaudhary
column9:
HoD CSE (Member) Special Invitees from other departments.
Working Committee
Center Head - HoD CSE Chief Organiser - Dr. Sonam Gupta 
Project Implementation Committee
Principal Investigator(PI) - Faculty
column10: on project basis Research Assistant(RA) - Student
column11:
on project basis 
Activities/Events
### COMMIT – 2 DAY Open Source Workshop
On 30th April and 1st May 2024 Open Source Software and Cyber Security Club of Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College hosted a two-day open source workshop “Commit"". The workshop was successfully conducted in the CSIT/Auditorium from 4:00 pm to 7:00 pm on 30th April & 1st May 2024.
The workshop introduced students to the world of open source development through a mix of lectures and hands-on activities. Sessions were designed to cover a range of topics
column13: collaborative coding on platforms like GitHub
column14: and contributing to open-source projects. Students got to work with Linux environments and learned about major open-source programs like Google Summer of Code (GSoC).\nThe event featured a coding contest that allowed students to apply their new skills. The contest had various challenges designed to test the students' understanding of open-source development and collaborative coding. The competition was intense
column15: with participants racing against the clock to solve the challenges.\nPrizes and certificates were awarded to the top three finishers in the contest. The first-place winner received a cash prize of Rs 3500
column16: while the second place and third place winners received Rs 2500 and Rs 1500
column17: respectively. All participants received certificates of participation
column18: and a bag of goodies.\nOverall
column19: “Commit"" was a positive experience
column20: team OSS is aiming to increase interest in open-source development. The workshop was conducted successfully under the guidance of Dr. Sonam Gupta
column21: faculty coordinator. A total of 40 students registered for the workshop.\n### ""Hour of Code"" Coding Competition\nOn 5 December 2023
column22: the ACM student Chapter at Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College held its annual “Hour of Code"" coding competition. The event was a great success
column23: with 109 students from the college participating.\nThe workshop was successfully conducted in the Project Lab (CS-IT Block) from 4:00 pm to 6:30pm on 5th December 2022.\nThe competition was held in the college's computer lab
column24: which was set up with 109 computers for the participants. Each computer was equipped with the necessary software and tools for the competition. The competition consisted of a series of coding challenges in languages such as C
column26: and Java. The challenges were designed to test the students' problem-solving skills and knowledge of programming concepts such as loops
column27: variables
column28: and data types. The competition was fierce
column29: with students working hard to complete the challenges as quickly and accurately as possible. The competition consisted of a series of coding challenges
column30: designed to test the students' skills and knowledge in a variety of programming languages.\nThe winners of the competition will be awarded a cash prize and certificates. The first-place finisher will receive a cash prize of Rs 2000
column31: while the second will receive Rs 1000
column32:
and third-place finishers will receive a cash prize of Rs 500.
The “Hour of Code"" coding competition was a great success and an enjoyable experience for all the students who participated.
### Cyber Security Challenges
One day seminar on “CYBER SECURITY CHALLENGES” was organized by ACM Student Chapter and Open Source Software & Cyber Security Club under Department of Computer Science and Engineering on 27 February 2023 for 6th semester CSE students.
The seminar was conducted by Mr. Ashwani Kumar. He is a cyber security practitioner
column33: learning and guiding about security management
column34: vulnerability assessment
column36: threat hunting and more. Currently he is working with Linear Stack where he researches
column37: analyze and defend to provide cyber security in much better way. He is also Cyber Crime Intervention Officer certified by Information Sharing and Analysis Center
column38: India where he was able to add up his name under National Security Database.\n126 students participated in the seminar and explored various dimensions of cyber security. The workshop encouraged students to gain knowledge on various challenges of cyber security. The coordinators of the workshop were Dr. Sonam Gupta
column39: Dr. Charu Agarwal
column40: and Mr. Pradeep Gupta.\n### \nOSS R&D Centre conducted “Node Jam” – a workshop on node JS” and all its prerequisites such as HTML
column41: CSS and JavaScript. ‘Node Jam’ was a workshop conducted to give a fresh start to students for web development and mainly in the field of backend development. The workshop started from the very basics of web development and gradually moved towards more advanced concepts such as modern javascript
column43:
Express and mongodb.
The workshop was successfully conducted in the Computer Centre – 1 (CS-IT Block) from 4:00 pm to 7:00pm on 26 May to 28 May 2022.
35 students participated in this workshop; all students are provided certificates of participation to encourage further participation in such knowledgeable events.
The workshop fulfilled its purpose by providing students the right path to become a full stack developer. It has allowed students to have a deep understanding of how web works and what should be the pathway to learn development.
### 
OSS R&D Centre
column44:
conducted “Cypher’20” – a Workshop on Web security on 29th February & 1st March 2020. ‘Cypher’20’ was a workshop conducted to spread awareness amongst college students about cyber security paving a way towards building a strong foundation. The workshop was mainly focused on ways to secure application and spread awareness about threats in modern technology and ways to prevent them.
The workshop was successfully conducted in the Computer Centre – 1 (CS-IT Block) from 9:00 am to 5:00 pm on 29th March 2020 and 9:00 am to 5:00 pm on 1st March 2020. Total 72 students registered for the workshop. The workshop fulfilled its main purpose- ‘To introduce the students the basics of web security and spread awareness for it.
### 
OSS R&D Centre
column45: AKGEC in association with CodeChef conducted “Code-O-Fiesta 2019 – an Online Coding Contest on 26 September 2019. ‘Code-O-Fiesta’ was an initiative which aroused from a combative attitude that paves a way towards building a strong foundation. The contest was basically a step to upgrade the knowledge and combative spirit of students regarding their coding skills and competence. The contest was successfully conducted in the CSE Labs from 4:00 pm to 6:30 pm on 26 September 2019. Total 70 teams (97 Students) registered for the event and out of these 43 teams (69 Students) actually participated in the event. Out of total registered teams
column46:
18 teams (27 students) were from non CS/IT branch. A set of 5 questions were given to the candidates to solve within the time limit (2 hours) and teams were ranked by CodeChef on the basis of marks and the time engrossed to solve the problem.
### 
OSS R&D Centre conducted “Cypher’19” – a Workshop on Cyber security and Linux on 09 & 10 March 2019. ‘Cypher 19’ was a workshop conducted to spread awareness amongst college students about cyber security paving a way towards building a strong foundation. The workshop was mainly focused on ways to secure application and spread awareness about threats in modern technology and ways to prevent them. The workshop was successfully conducted in the Computer Centre – 1 (CS-IT Block) from 4:00 pm to 6:00 pm on 9 March 2019 and 9:00 am to 6:00 pm on 10 March 2019. Total 45 students registered for the workshop.
### 
CONATUS and OSS R&D Centre
column47: AKGEC in association with CodeChef conducted “Code-O-Fiesta 2018 – an Online Coding Contest on 20 September 2018. **‘Code-O-Fiesta’** was an initiative which aroused from a combative attitude that paves a way towards building a strong foundation. The contest was basically a step to upgrade the knowledge and combative spirit of students regarding their coding skills and competence. The top 3 teams were awarded with Rs 1500
column48: Rs 1000 and Rs 500 respectively and certificates.\n### \nThe event was conducted on 6 September
column49: 2017 where over 60 teams participated in the coding event powered by CodeChef and OSSRNDC. The top 3 teams were awarded with Rs 1000

Rs 800 and Rs 500 respectively and certificates.

content_chunk: "# Software Incubator – SDC\n**SOFTWARE INCUBATOR** is the research and development center of Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College
column3: Ghaziabad. The purpose of the department is to handle official projects as required by the college. The department consists of students from 2nd to 4th year who are proficient in a number of technical domains including Website Development
column5: AI/ML
column6: Blockchain
column8: UI/UX Designing and other emerging technologies.\nThe department is provided with a dedicated lab
column9:
equipped with the state-of-the-art infrastructure & hardware/software tools available to the SDC members throughout the day. This provides a highly conducive & stimulating environment for the young brains to explore & come out with innovative solutions using emerging technologies.
Website: [www.silive.in](https://silive.in/)

### DESKTOP APPLICATION DEVELOPMENT
We have developers who are solely developing desktop applications and high end software products. We develop highly user interactive applications for industry as well as for personal use. We work on technologies that include high performance and minimize the system requirements.
### MOBILE APPLICATION DEVELOPMENT
We realize that the world is changing it's trends from typewriter to keyboard and now from click to touch. Hence
column10: we here at Software Incubator develop mobile as well as tablet apps. The apps we make are for Android
column11: iOS and Windows devices. Today in the market and even tomorrow
column12: our apps never die.\n### WEBSITE DEVELOPMENT\nWe offer great Websites and Web applications
column13: understanding the clients' needs and requirements. We deliver the projects built on the latest technologies in the market-place at most diminishing costs. We give a larger hand to the latest trends of website development

especially SEO. The websites we provide are fully secure and give support to data security and integrity.

where industry experts shared their knowledge about AR/VR Technology.

### SDC ACTIVITIES
### 
AKGEC's SDC ITeR8 workshop
column19: held from April 19th to April 22nd

a coding contest enabled participants to apply their newly acquired skills in a competitive environment.
### 
SDC-SI conducted a Workshop named “Runtym” for students of the first year to introduce them to the concepts of Competitive Programming. It helped the students to boost up their algorithmic thinking and problem-solving approaches.
The purpose of the workshop was to introduce the students to the world of competitive programming and help them in solving well-defined problems by writing programs under specified limits
column29: consequently raising their technical level.\nThe workshop was interactive and informative. A presentation was prepared containing explanations for each topic in simple language with examples. Complicated topics were broken down into simpler explanations. Furthermore
column30: study material and resources related to the topics were provided to the students to ease their journey of learning. Students were encouraged to ask their doubts which were cleared positively.\nIt was a 22-hour long workshop spanned over four days from 21th April
column31: 2023 to 24th April

column33: 2023. Certificates of participation are to be provided on behalf of SDC-SI.\n### \nAmong the 1500+ national-level participants

column36: Ghaziabad
column37: have made their college proud by bagging the First Runner-Up prize in the Paradigm Hackathon at Shiv Nadar University. The Rs.50000 prize pool included a cash prize of Rs.12000 and additional benefits such as AWS credits and Canva Pro. The talented students – Ayush Raghuwanshi
column38: Suhail Ahmad

This success is a testament to the students’ hard work
column43: dedication
column44: and technical skills

and it is a great achievement for Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College.
### 
**Details of journey**
The 3rd and 4th year members of SDC-SI visited Vorphy and Exampur
column46: Noida on 23rd November 2022 along with two faculty members. The visit was coordinated by the HOD of SDC-SI
column47: Dr. Sachin Kumar. We departed from the college at 9:30 A.M. in the college bus and reached the headquarters of Vorphy at 10:30 A.M. At Vorphy
column48: Mr. Saksham Saini
column49: CTO and co-founder of Vorphy
column50: coordinated our visit. We got a demonstration of their latest software based on AR/VR. The software is developed for students to ease their learning process through the visualisation of various concepts.\nAfter lunch
column51: we visited the headquarters of Exampur where we got an opportunity to experience the working of Exampur studios. The tour was led by the Chief Operations Officer of Exampur. A few of the SDC members also went live on the Exampur YouTube session. At Exampur
column52: we met Mr. Vardaan Gandhi who is the co-founder of Exampur and an alumnus of AKGEC. He motivated us for the future and encouraged us to seek any kind of help from him and his team. We also interacted with various employees of Vorphy and Exampur and sought guidance from them.\n**Company Profile****Vorphy:**\nVorphy is headquartered at Noida
column53: Uttar Pradesh and is a small scale startup with over 50 employees. Vorphy aims at providing an incredibly engaging simulated learning environment where the students can equip their curriculum world with revolutionary virtual experiences via XR.\nExtended Reality often referred to as XR includes the combination of Virtual Reality (VR)
column54: Augmented Reality (AR) and Mixed Reality (MR). It extends your reality by simulating the real environment using accessible sensors
column55: networks and shared online virtual worlds.Students can participate in exciting activities and simulations in order to understand the practical concepts of various subjects.\nVorphy also uses 3D animations to aid comprehension. Learners can indulge themselves in different topics and lessons to determine which activity suits them depending on their skills.\n**Exampur:** Exampur is headquartered at Noida
column56: Uttar Pradesh and is medium scale startup with over 100 employees. Exampur is one of the highly trusted and most magnificent online e-learning platforms with live classes
column57: mock test papers
column58: daily current affairs
column59: and many more. Exampur is India's best exam preparation app for several competitive examinations.\nTheir aim is to provide courses for government exam preparation
column60: with a hybrid model that provides offline and online teaching facilities to aspirants from Tier II
column61: III
column62: and IV cities. They have a long list of achievements some of which are:• 10 Millions+ Subscribers on Youtube Channels• 1.1 Billions+ Views on Live/Video Classes• 25+ Youtube Channels on different Category• Every Week 3-4 Videos In Trending On YouTube• Daily 2.5 Million+ views• Daily 150+ live classes\n**Group Observation**\nAt Vorphy
column63: we got the demonstration of their latest software. Observed their workplace culture. Got to know about the process that
column64: the software goes through
column65: in its development phase. Interacted with the employees of their various departments and got a close overview of how the work is done.\nAt Exampur
column66: we visited the studios where live classes are held. Got an opportunity to understand the business model of these companies. Sought guidance from the co-founders and various chief officers. Interacted with the software used in Exampur studios.\n**Conclusion**\nWe are thankful to all our faculties for organising such an Informative event for us. Such visits are crucial for the development of our practical skills and knowledge. We got the opportunity to know about different types of software technologies used in Vorphy and Exampur. We are also thankful to Mr. Saksham Saini for coordinating our visit to Vorphy
column67: and to Mr. Vardaan Gandhi for such an interactive meeting at Exampur. We would like to be a part of more such visits in the future.\n### \nThis workshop was conducted by the team of Vorphy for 3rd year students to introduce them to the concepts of virtual reality
column68: augmented reality
column69: metaverse etc. The workshop was designed for the students to increase their interests in upcoming technologies.\nThe purpose of the workshop was to introduce the students to the concept of virtual reality in a fun and interactive way. It also taught students about the necessity of such technologies in today’s world.\nThe workshop was interactive and informative. A presentation was prepared containing explanations for each topic in simple language with examples. Complicated topics were broken down into simpler explanations. Furthermore
column70:
study material and resources related to the topics were provided to the students to ease their journey of learning. Students were encouraged to ask their doubts which were cleared positively.
It was a 10-hour long workshop spanned over 5 days from 14th November 2022 to 18th November 2022.
**Event Description**
The 5-day long workshop included both theory and practical implementation of each of the topics covered. Registration for the event was open for 3rd year students. The workshop was conducted in the Computer Centre. All attendees were provided with assignments and resources related to the topics covered on a daily basis.
**Topics covered in the workshop:** Introduction to Augmented RealityIntroduction to UnityImage targeting in AR using Vuforia and unityBasics about general physics in unityHands on experience on snapchat AR lens studioBasics about meshes
column71: textures and other assets of 3D modelsBasics about game development through unityCreated Snapchat filter using lab studioCreated 2 apps using unity\n**Instructor:** Saksham Saini
column72:
CTO and Co-founder Vorphy.
**Accomplishments**
SDC received an overwhelming 186 registrations* from the 3rd year students among which 70 lucky students were selected to attend the workshop. SDC-SI successfully conducted the workshop maintaining the audience’s attention and spirit of the event throughout the entire duration of the workshop.
The workshop introduced the participants to upcoming technologies like AR/VR. The participants gained practical knowledge about basic concepts
column73: hands-on experience in creating 2 apps and a snapchat filter with the guidance from the instructor. The workshop broadened the horizon of the participants and ushered them to unfurl new milestones in this field and beyond.* The list of attendees is attached for reference.\nWe received an overwhelming and extremely positive response from the 3rd year students.“Lots of topics covered in very less time.”“This workshop is good for beginners and a very convenient way to start building a grasp on AR/VR

content_chunk: "# Training Programs\n### \nAKGEC-Fronius (Advance Welding Technology &Research Centre) organized Train the Trainer Program on Advance Welding Technology for Engineers/Supervisors of Carriage and Wagon Repair Workshop
column4: Jagadhri. Total 08 participants of the ranks from Senior Section Engineers
column5: Junior Engineers and Trainers
column6: attended this fully residential program during 6-11 January
column8: hands-on sessions were conducted on SMAW and GMAW welding processes along with guest lectures by industry experts. Candidates were also trained to implement good welding practices and industrial safety measures in workshop environment. On completion
column9: certificates were awarded to the candidates by Prof. Ashiv Shah
column10: COO in presence of Mr. Ashish Apte
column11: Segment Manager
column12: Fronius India Ltd during valedictory session.\n### \nAKGEC-Fronius Advance Welding Technology and Research Center (AWTRC) organized a Welder Training Program on Stainless Steel Welding for welders and technicians of M/s Jindal Stainless Ltd. during 13-14 February
column13: 2020. The program was organized in collaboration with Fronius India Pvt. Ltd. In this training program 10 practicing welders and technicians from M/s Jindal Stainless Ltd. participated and performed welding using Gas Metal Arc Welding (GMAW) and Gas Tungsten Arc Welding (GTAW) processesin 1F
column14:
2F and 3F positions on Stainless Steel grade 304 and 308.
Achievement Test and Practical Assessment of the participants was conducted at the end to evaluate the training effectiveness at AWTRC.
### 
5th International Congress (IC-2020) on “Advanced Welding Technology & Quality Systems for Developing Economies"" was organized during 6th -8th Feb' 2020 at Mumbai by the International Institute of Welding and hosted by The Indian Institute of Welding (IIW India).
It was attended by more than 350 National and International Delegates representing various Industries related to welding & allied fields
column15: academic & research institutions and National / International welding Associations & Professional Bodies.\nConcurrently WELDINDIA 2020 – a three day exhibition was held during 7-9 February
column16: 2020 at CIDCO Exhibition Centre
column17: New Mumbai. More than 100 companies from Metallurgy
column18: Material Testing & NDT
column19: specially Welding
column20: Fabricating & allied products industries showcased their latest development and professional branding in the Indian as well as international market during the exhibition.\nAKGEC participated in the Congress as one of its sponsors and exhibited its training
column21: research and consultancy facilities under AKGEC Skills Foundation in the WELD INDIA 2020 Exhibition.\n### \nSmart India Hackathon (SIH) – 2020 is a nationwide initiative of the Ministry of HRD and AICTE to provide students a platform to solve some of the pressing problems that we face in our daily lives and thus inculcate a culture of product innovation and a mindset of problem solving. SIH provides students the opportunity to work on the challenges faced within various ministries
column22: departments
column23: industries
column24: PSUs and NGOs to create optimal solutions.\nSIH 2020
column25: the fourth edition of the Hackathon
column26: requires all participating institutions to conduct an internal Hackathon
column27: both in software and hardware domains
column28: for short listing the teams for the final round.\nThe AKGEC internal SIH
column31: was participated enthusiastically by 20 teams in the software domains and 8 in the hardware domain.\nThe innovative ideas and unorthodox solutions to various problems were evaluated by a panel of judges including Mr. Kulmani Gupta
column32: Managing Director
column33: Shristhi Softech Solutions (P) Ltd.
column34: Mr. Ajay Bandhu Saksena Founder and CEO Samarth Mechatronics (P) Ltd. and senior faculty from engineering departments at AKGEC.\nThe teams were judged on the basis of the novelty of the idea
column36: clarity
column37: feasibility
column38: practicability & sustainability of the solution
column39: potential for future work progression and presentation and communication skills.\nSeven teams-five in software domain and two in hardware domain
column40: were selected for participation in the final round of SIH 2020.\nThe opening ceremony for the SIH was graced by the presence of Mr. Kulmani Gupta
column43: Mr. Ajay Bandhu Saksena Founder and CEO Samarth Mechatronics (P) Ltd.
column44: Dr. R.K. Agarwal
column45: Director General AKGEC
column46: Heads of Departments
column47: Deans
column48: faculty and students.\nDuring the valedictory ceremony held towards the end of the day
column49: the winning teams were awarded certificates of appreciation. The participating students were appreciated for their efforts and encouraged to participate more and more in such events.\n### \nAKGEC FRONIUS Advance Welding Technology & Research Centre
column50: AKGEC Skills Foundation organized a fully residential training program on Brazing Technology for the engineers of Honda R&D India Pvt. Ltd.
column51: Manesar on 25 and 26 April
column52: 2019. The program was jointly organized with Indian Institute of Welding (IIW) and attended by six engineers from Honda R&D Division
column53: Manesar.\nThe introductory session was delivered by Prof. Som Ashutosh
column54: AGM (QA&A) followed by session on Safety and Good Engineering Practices in Brazing by Mr. Vivek Singh
column55: Scientific Officer. Mr. Harish Khurana
column56: Vice President (North)
column57: IIW India and Mr. Pradeep Paul
column58: Executive Member
column59: IIW Delhi also provided an insight of the Brazing Process. Hands on sessions included brazing on lap and pipe joints in plat horizontal and vertical positions.\n### \nAKGEC FRONIUS Advance Welding Technology & Research Centre
column60: AKGEC Skills Foundation
column61: organized training program on Welding Technology for the maintenance staff of Indigo Airlines from 1 st to 3 rd April
column62: 2019. The program was organized in collaboration with TÜV Rheinland (India) Pvt. Ltd. as the certifying body. Sessions on Good Engineering Practices
column63: Shielded Metal Arc Welding
column64: Gas Metal Arc Welding Process and Weld Defects & Trouble shooting were conducted by Scientific Officers
column65: AKGEC Skills. Hands on sessions were conducted at AKGEC Skills as well as at Indigo Airlines welding workshop situated inside the New Delhi Airport. Theoretical and practical assessment of the participants was conducted to evaluate the training effectiveness using Virtual Welding Simulator at AWTRC.\n### \nModern Coach Factory (MCF)
column66: is committed to a SMART Township
column67: SMART Factory and SMART Coach approach duly striving with assiduity for quality Rail Coaches.\nMCF in its endeavour to produce nearly 2000 Coaches per year
column68: including LHB
column69: Metro coaches and most modern high speed train sets
column70: has been instrumental in developing technical competency of its Officers.\nTo provide technical insight of multidisciplinary tools and technologies operational in the field of Automation & Robotics
column71: as a part of Smart Manufacturing Concepts
column72: AKGEC Skills Foundation organised two weeks exclusive training program for ten ‘Young Railway Officers’ at AKGEC Campus Ghaziabad from 17th July’18 to 31st July 2018\nUnder this program participants were given opportunity to get technical exposure and hands on working experience at various Centres of Excellence operational at AKGEC Campus. Participants explored available high end Manual and Robotic welding processes
column73: Reverse Engineering and 3D Printing Technology
column74: Advance Manufacturing including Measurement and Metrology concepts. After successful completion of the training program
column75: all participants were awarded with Certificate of Merit by AKGEC Skills Foundation.\n  * 27th Km Milestone
